dcei.engine.proto.Ability.content: Abilities are spells or skills that are cast by units. Similar to weapons, abilities create effect trees that determine their functionality.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.ability_type.content:
Determines how the ability's target location is chosen. Targeted abilities will cause the caster to enter [targeting mode](Trigger-API-Reference-DCEI-Functions-Ability#void-entertargetingmodeunit-unit-string-abilityname) while selecting a cast location. 

**NONE_ABILITY_TYPE**:  

**TARGET**:  When cast, the target for the effect of the ability is a unit or location within range of the ability.

**INSTANT**:  When cast, the casting unit or location is the target for the effect of the ability.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.cast_type.content:
**(NOTE: Currently AUTO type is not supported for targeted abilities)**.

**NONE_CAST_TYPE**:  

**MANUAL**:  The player must activate the ability themselves.

**AUTO**:  The ability will automatically be cast when off cooldown and the validators are met.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.target_range_m.content:
**NORMAL**:  When cast outside of the ability's range, the caster will attempt to move into range before casting.

**CLAMP**:  When cast outside of the ability's range, the caster will cast the ability at the ability's maximum range in the direction of the target.

**MAX_RANGE**:  The ability will always be cast at the maximum range in the direction of the target.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.effect.content:
The effect used by the ability when it is cast.

See: [Data/Effect](Data-Effect)
For [targeted abilities](#ability-type), this effect determines whether this ability can target units, locations, or both. This is usually decided by the effect's 'Target Type' or 'Location' field, though some effect types always occur at a unit or location.
* **Example 1**: If the effect is a [Persistent](Data-Effect-Persistent) with [location](Data-Effect-Persistent#location) set to 'Target Location', then the ability targets locations. 
* **Example 2**: If the effect is a [Damage](Data-Effect-Damage) effect (which occurs on a unit), then the ability targets units.

dcei.engine.proto.AbilityStats.prep_time.content:
The delay between the ability being cast and the effect being executed.

Used with [Finish Time](#finish-time) for the purposes of animating the unit.

dcei.engine.proto.AbilityStats.finish_ti.content:
The delay between the effect being executed and the ability ending.

The [Finish Time](#finish-time) begins as soon as [Prep Time](#prep-time) ends.
Used with [Prep Time](#prep-time) for the purposes of animating the unit. The sum of [Prep Time](#prep-time) plus [Finish Time](#finish-time) is the minimum cooldown of an ability.

dcei.engine.proto.AbilityStats.cooldown.content:
The cooldown of the ability or how long the unit must wait to use it again.

The [Cooldown](#cooldown) begins as soon as [Prep Time](#prep-time) ends.
If [Max Charge](#max-charge) is greater than 1, this instead determines how long it takes to gain another charge of the ability. In this case the cooldown of the ability is instead the sum of [Prep Time](#prep-time) plus [Finish Time](#finish-time) as long as there is another charge on the ability.

dcei.engine.proto.AbilityStats.use_initi.content: If checked, this ability will start on cooldown.

dcei.engine.proto.AbilityStats.use_coold.content: If checked, this ability will enter cooldown when it is disabled then enabled.

dcei.engine.proto.AbilityStats.range.content: The maximum distance for the target of the ability.

dcei.engine.proto.AbilityStats.scan_rang.content: If ability's abilty type is **TARGET** and cast type is **AUTO**, this is the range that unit will use to search for targets.

dcei.engine.proto.AbilityStats.max_charg.content: The maximum number of charges for an ability. In order for an ability to be able to be cast, this number must be 1 or greater.

dcei.engine.proto.AbilityStats.arc.content: The angle in front of the caster that targets must be in. If the target is outside this arc, the caster will attempt to turn to face the target before casting. Example: Arc 360 means the ability can be cast in any direction, 90 is a cone in front, and 0 is directly facing the target.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.use_unit_cost_.content:
If the ability contains a morph effect, uses the difference in gold cost between the two units as the ability's gold cost.

If the ability contains a morph effect, uses the difference in gold cost between the two units as the ability's gold cost.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.add_to_unit_co.content: When checked, the cost of unit will be increased by the gold cost of the ability when it is cast.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.cost.content: What resources the unit uses when it casts the ability. If the unit is unable to meet any of the costs, it is unable to cast the ability.

dcei.engine.proto.AbilityCost.health.content: How much health the unit loses when the ability is cast.

dcei.engine.proto.AbilityCost.mana.content: How much mana the unit loses when the ability is cast.

dcei.engine.proto.AbilityCost.gold.content: How much gold the player loses when the ability is cast.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.priority.content: Abilities with higher priority can interrupt the casting of abilities with lower priority.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.family.content: Can be used to target specific abilities for cooldown or charge modification using the [Modify Unit](Data-Effect-Modify-Unit) effect.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.Validators.content:
Each validator must succeed in order for the ability to be able to be cast.

See: [Data/Validator](Data-Validator)

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.level.content: Ability level reference that can be referenced in validator expressions.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.can_cast_while.content: If this is checked, using this ability will not stop movement.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.is_rally_abili.content: Used for additional rally ability functionality in Wild Sky.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.disabled.content: When checked, the ability is disabled by default. Requires behaviors or other means to be enabled.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.hide.content: When checked, the ability is hidden from the command card by default. Requires behaviors or other means to be visible.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.highlight.content: If checked, the ability will always be highlighted on the unit's command card and a behavior or some other means will be needed to stop it.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.ability_tags.content:
Used in conjunction with Issue Ability effect to cast abilities with specific tags.

See: [Data/Effect/Issue Ability](Data-Effect-Issue-Ability).
Can also be used to target specific abilities for cooldown reduction using the [Modify Unit](Data-Effect-Modify-Unit) effect.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.charge_ignore_.content: If checked, the ability charges will not recover each cooldown. Instead the ability charges must be changed some other way.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.show_charge_co.content: Whether the charges of the ability are displayed in the in-game UI or not.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.critical_chanc.content: The chance that the ability usage is considered a critical. The value is a fraction, so 0 is 0% chance and 1 is 100% chance of critical hit.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.critical_effec.content:
The effect that is executed instead of the effect when the ability is a critical.

If this is not set, the default [effect](#effect) will be used on critical instead.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.dependent_unit.content:
Dependent units will be loaded when the ability is loaded.

Any units declared here will be preloaded when this ability is preloaded. This is an alternative to declaring data in [Settings](Data-ProjectSetting).

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.dependent_effe.content:
Dependent effects will be loaded when this unit is loaded.

Any effects declared here will be preloaded when this ability is preloaded. This is an alternative to declaring data in [Settings](Data-ProjectSetting).

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.dependent_beha.content:
Dependent behaviors will be loaded when this unit is loaded.

Any behaviors declared here will be preloaded when this ability is preloaded. This is an alternative to declaring data in [Settings](Data-ProjectSetting).

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.command_card_i.content:
What slot of the In-Game UI Command Card the ability occupies.

Can be used to lay out the abilities on a unit in a certain manner.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.command_card_c.content: If the ability needs to be confirmed (i.e., tap a second time to use), the icon to display after the first tap.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.command_card_d.content: The text that the ability button displays when it is opened.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.command_card_e.content: The icon for the ability when it is enhanced.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.command_card_o.content: The icon for the ability when it has an ornament.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.preserve_menu.content: When the ability is used through the tower menu, the menu stays open.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.description.content: Used by wild sky, can be used for the description of an ability.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.title.content: Used by wild sky, can be used to form a title for the ability.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.affinity_index.content:
The affinity of this ability. Only set this field if: 1. this is a ship ability. 2. and this ability is used as a built-in ability (i.e., not added through a loadout spell card but available in the level automatically). The mapping: 1 => normal 2 => fire 3 => ice 4 => nature 5 => light 6 => dark.

Used by Wild Sky to help associate abilities with affinities.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.card_name.content: Used to associate the ability with a card name for damage stats tracking.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.targeting_vali.content: The cursor actor used for the ability's target mode when the target is valid.

dcei.engine.proto.Ability.targeting_inva.content: The cursor actor used for the ability's target mode when the target is invalid.

dcei.engine.proto.Actor.action_actor.content: Action Actors don't have models or sounds themselves, but are used to help hook up visuals and sounds to effects. You generally want to have at least one action actor for each [Weapon] and [Ability](Data-Ability).

dcei.engine.proto.ActionActor.effect.content:
The effect that triggers the action.

Typically used to set the impact actor of a single effect (such as a [Damage](Data-Effect-Damage) effect or [Area Search](Data-Effect-Area-Search)) or the launch and impact actor of a [Launch Missile](Data-Effect-Launch-Missile) effect.

dcei.engine.proto.ActionActor.launch_mod.content: The actor that's created when the action actor's effect starts. Uses the start location of the **effect**
When checked, prevents the launch model from following a unit if the **effect** target is a unit.

dcei.engine.proto.ActionActor.impact_mod.content: The actor that's created when the action actor's **effect** ends. Uses the end location of the effect.
When checked, prevents the impact model from following a unit if the **effect** target is a unit.

dcei.engine.proto.ActionActor.beam_model.content: Creates a beam between the action's **launch site** and **target site**.

dcei.engine.proto.ActionActor.launch_sit.content: Used to attach the launch model to a [Host Site](Data-Actor-Unit-Actor#host-sites) on the caster.

dcei.engine.proto.ActionActor.target_sit.content: Used to attach the impact model to a [Host Site](Data-Actor-Unit-Actor#host-sites) on the target.

dcei.engine.proto.ActionActor.launch_sit.content: Site operations applied to the **launch model**.

dcei.engine.proto.ActionActor.target_sit.content: Site operations applied to the **impact model**.

dcei.engine.proto.ActionActor.additional.content: Used to add additional launch and impact models to the action.

dcei.engine.proto.Actor.model_actor.content: Model actors are used for all non-unit visuals and sound effects in the game. Each individual visual effect or sound has its own model actor. Shares many fields with [Unit Actor](Data-Actor-Unit-Actor).

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.resource.content: The asset to use for the actor. This determines what the actor looks or sounds like.

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.event_macro.content:
Event macros will be expanded after the events field.

Adds a collection of actor events to the actor via [Event Macros](Data-Actor-Event-Macro).

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.host_site.content: Where this actor will be attached to in the actor scope. It can be the name of an actor (that actor will be used as the parent and this actor will be attached to its origin point), or a host site defined in an actor (that actor will be used as the parent and the referenced site will be the attach point), or an attachment defined in the model of an actor.

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.host_site_o.content: A set of operations applied to the host site position/rotation to determine the final position/rotation for this actor.

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.host_sites.content: Define a list of named sites on this actor that other actors can be attached to (or reference).

dcei.engine.proto.HostSite.offset.content: The position of the host site, relative to the actor's origin position.

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.additional_.content: If set, a random resource will be chosen from a list comprised of this list and the [Resource Name](#resource-name). This is useful for playing random voice lines, among other uses.

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.model_scale.content: Adjusts the size of the model. Using 0 defaults to 1.

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.selection_b.content:
Adjusts the size of this actors's hit sphere for mouse selection and targeting if the model actor is within the scope of a unit actor. Useful for making small units more click-friendly.

Can be previewed in [Debug Options](Debugging-Features).

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.aliases.content: User defined name references that can be used to send messages to this actor from other actors in the same scope.

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.include_in_.content: When enabled, the model actor counts as selectable when within the scope of a unit actor.

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.selection_s.content: Used to change mouse selection collider from sphere (default) to a cube. Useful for games with grid-based selection.
Adjusts the scale of the selection collider if **Selection Shape** is set to Cube.

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.hide_shadow.content: Prevents the actor from casting a shadow.

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.scale_multi.content: Sets the scale of the actor across individual axes. The final scale will be these values multiplied by the **Model Scale**.

dcei.engine.proto.ModelActor.sprite_opti.content: Sprite options are for actor using sprite as resource.

dcei.engine.proto.Actor.site_operation.content:
Site operations are special actors that modify the position or rotation of other actors.

They can be used to do things like adding offsets to attached models or rotating a model to be upside down. Some site operations can also be used to apply motion over time to create basic "animations", such as making a unit spin or slowly float up and then down. 
Site operations can be applied via various [Site Operation](Data-Actor-Unit-Actor#host-site-operations) fields or through [Actor Events](Data-ActorEvent). Site operations stack cumulatively in the order in which they are applied.
**Note**: Unit actors (and site operations applied to them) are purely the visual representation and not game objects themselves. Applying site operations to offset or rotate a unit actor does not change the unit's position or facing.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.offset.content:
Applies an offset to the actor's position.

The offset is relative to the [Orientation](#orientation).

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.rotate.content:
Rotates an actor.

The X/Y/Z fields are used to apply static rotation (or a one-off rotation over time using actor [Events](Actor-Events)). The Dx/Dy/Dz field are used to apply a constant rotation over time (aka spin). The rotation is relative to the [Orientation](#orientation).
**Note**: [Event Orientation](#orientation) and [Move Orientation](#orientation) settings are special cases that behave slightly differently than other orientations.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Rotate.x.content: The rotation in degrees around the X axis (aka Pitch).

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Rotate.y.content: The rotation in degrees around the Y axis (aka Yaw).

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Rotate.z.content: The rotation in degrees around the Z axis (aka Roll).

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Rotate.d.content: The rotation in degrees per second around the X axis.
The rotation in degrees per second around the Y axis.
The rotation in degrees per second around the Z axis.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Rotate.o.content: Determines relative orientation of the rotation.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.absolute.content:
Set's the absolute height (or Y position) of the actor. Can be used to make aura VFX appear at ground height regardless of unit height (assuming no cliffs are used).

Functionally similar to [Absolute Y](Data-Actor-Site-Operation-Absolute-Y) Site Op.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Absolute.content: Sets the absolute height of the actor.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.hold_pos.content: Makes the actor no longer update position or rotation.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.absolute.content: Sets the absolute position of an actor using world orientation.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Absolute.content: Horizontal position on the world grid. A value of 0 is the map's left edge.
Height position on the world grid. A value of 0 is the map's base height.
Vertical position on the world grid. A value of 0 is the map's bottom edge.
If set, a random value between 0 and the X Range will be applied to the X position when this site operation is applied. Only accepts positive values.
If set, a random value between 0 and the Y Range will be applied to the Y position when this site operation is applied. Only accepts positive values.
If set, a random value between 0 and the Z Range will be applied to the Z position when this site operation is applied. Only accepts positive values.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.absolute.content: Locks the actor to a specific X value on the world grid.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Absolute.content: Horizontal position on the world grid. A value of 0 is the map's left edge.
If set, a random value between 0 and the X Range will be applied to the X position when this site operation is applied. Only accepts positive values.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.absolute.content:
Locks the actor to a specific Y value on the world grid.

Functionally similar to the [Absolute Height](Data-Actor-Site-Operation-Absolute-Height) Site Op.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Absolute.content: Height position on the world grid. A value of 0 is the map's base height.
If set, a random value between 0 and the Y Range will be applied to the Y position when this site operation is applied. Only accepts positive values.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.absolute.content: Locks the actor to a specific Z value on the world grid.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Absolute.content: Vertical position on the world grid. A value of 0 is the map's bottom edge.
If set, a random value between 0 and the Z Range will be applied to the Z position when this site operation is applied. Only accepts positive values.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.ballisti.content: Makes the actor move to a target position. Works the same as a Ballistic Mover.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Ballisti.content: The offset for the target position of this site operation. This offset is relative the source actor's position and facing. Note that BallisticMove siteOperation may not work correctly with other siteOperation types that also change actors' positions.
When set, the actor move speed will be adjusted so that it takes this time to reach its target, regardless of the distance. When using flight time, speed should be set to 0.
A random value between 0 and this value is added to the flight time.
Speed of the Actor. When using speed, flight time should be set to 0. Speed is measured in terrain grid-units-per-second.
A random value between 0 and this value is added to the speed.
Used to determine the height of the arc. Higher values mean a higher arc.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.orbit.content: Makes the actor orbit its host site.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Orbit.ra.content: Sets the offset radius that the actor will orbit round its host.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Orbit.sp.content: Sets the speed of the orbit in degrees per second.

dcei.engine.proto.Actor.unit_actor.content:
Unit actors determine how units look, sound, and animate. Units are linked to actors with the same name, and unit actors are automatically created without needing additional actor events.

Making changes to the **Presentation** fields of a unit will automatically create a new unit actor of the same name. Editing these fields will update the data of the linked unit actor.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.resource.content: The asset to use for the actor. This determines what the actor looks or sounds like.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.preserve_on_.content: By default, unit actor will be destroyed automatically when the unit is removed (on the UnitRemove event). When this flag is enabled enabled, the actor is not removed with the unit and must be destroyed with actor events. Enabling this flag is necessary for playing a death animations on the unit.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.event_macros.content:
Event macros will be expanded after the events field.

Adds a collection of actor events to the actor via [Event Macros](Data-Actor-Event-Macro).

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.host_sites.content: Defines a list of named sites on this actor that other actors can be attached to (or reference).

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.walk_animati.content: Adjusts the speed of the unit's walk animation. This can be used to correct "slippery feet" on certain models.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.model_scale.content: Adjusts the size of the model. Using 0 defaults to 1.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.host_site_op.content: A set of operations applied to the host site position/rotation to determine the final position/rotation for this actor.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.selection_bo.content:
Adjusts the size of this actors's hit sphere for mouse selection and targeting if the model actor is within the scope of a unit actor. Useful for making small units more click-friendly.

Can be previewed in [Debug Options](Debugging-Features).

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.exclude_from.content: If checked, this actor will not be considered as part of the unit when doing hit tests or calculating the bounds of the unit. If you use this flag, make sure there is at least one **Model Actor** on this unit that has the **Include In Unit Body** flag checked.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.selection_sh.content: Used to change mouse selection collider from sphere (default) to a cube. Useful for games with grid-based selection.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.selection_sc.content: Adjusts the scale of the selection collider if **Selection Shape** is set to Cube.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.aliases.content: User defined name references that can be used to send messages to this actor from other actors in the same scope.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.hide_shadow.content: Prevents the actor from casting a shadow.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.scale_multip.content: Sets the scale of the actor across individual axes. The final scale will be these values multiplied by the **Model Scale**.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.sprite_optio.content: Sprite options are for actor using sprite as resource.

dcei.engine.proto.Actor.content: Actors are a complex and powerful piece of data that determines how units, visual effects, and sounds are presented in-game. The majority of how actors behave is configured with [Actor Events](Data-ActorEvent).

dcei.engine.proto.ActorEvent.content:
Events are used to play animations on units in response to data events (like playing an attack animation when a unit attacks with a weapon or playing a death animation when a unit dies.)
Each event can have multiple conditions and multiple actions.
![events](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56179276/88447226-b076c500-cde5-11ea-9b8a-bef7de1189d8.png)
Similiar to triggers, actor events have 3 components.
* **Event**: The event that triggers the actor event.
* **Condition**: Optional conditions to evaluate. All conditions must succeed for the action to be executed.
* **Action**: The actions to execute in response to the event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorEvent.actor_term.content: An actor event can be used multiple times on an actor. When the same event is used more than once, the events are checked in order from top to bottom.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.unit_spawn.content: Triggers when the linked unit is spawned.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.unit_morph.content:
Triggers when a unit undergoes a **Morph** effect.

If **Unit Type** is not set, any morph on a unit will trigger this event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.unit_remove.content: Triggers when a unit is removed.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.unit_stand.content: Triggers when a unit leaves its movement state (ie, when it begins standing).

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.unit_walk.content: Triggers when a unit enters its movement state (ie, when it begins walking).

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.unit_weapon_.content:
Triggers when a unit begins attacking with a weapon.

If **Weapon** is not set, any weapon attack will trigger this event. If this event triggers a [Play Animation](#play-animation) action, the animation duration will be calculated from the weapon preswing + backswing, multiplied by any attack speed modifiers.
Triggers when a unit stops attacking with a weapon.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.unit_ability.content:
Triggers when a unit starts casting an ability.

If this event triggers a [Play Animation](#play-animation) action, the animation duration will be calculated from the ability prep time + finish time.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.UnitAbilityT.content: If left blank, any ability will trigger the event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.unit_ability.content: Triggers when a unit stops casting an ability.
Triggers when an ability enters targeting mode.
Triggers when an ability leaves targeting mode.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.unit_childre.content: Triggers when the children of this unit are selected.
Triggers when the children of this unit are deselected.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.unit_move_co.content: Triggers when a unit receives a movement command.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.unit_attack_.content: Triggers when a unit receives an attack command.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.unit_weapon_.content: Triggers when a unit executes an attack with a weapon (occurs after preswing).

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.pre_ability_.content: Triggers when a unit becomes highlighted by ability in targeting mode.
Triggers when a unit is unhighlighted by ability in targeting mode.
Sent to the target unit's actor scope when a targeting ability is cast on the unit.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.selection_on.content: Triggers when a unit is selected or on mouse hover.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.SelectionTer.content:
**SELECTION**:  Use **selection** for on select.

**PRE_SELECTION**:  Use **preselection** for on hover.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.selection_of.content: Triggers when a unit is deselected or on mouse hover off.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.behavior_on.content:
Triggers when a unit gains a behavior.

If **Behavior** is not set, any behavior will trigger this event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.BehaviorTerm.content: The behavior that triggers this event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.behavior_off.content:
Triggers when a unit loses a behavior (including if the behavior becomes disabled).

If **Behavior** is not set, any behavior will trigger this event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.behavior_sta.content: Triggers when a unit gains behavior stack(s).
Triggers when a unit loses behavior stack(s).

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.persistent_e.content:
Triggers when a persistent effect is created.

The persistent effect must have a [period count](Data-Effect-Persistent#periodic-count) of at least 1. If **Effect** is not set, any persistent effect will trigger this effect.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.EffectTerm.e.content: The persistent effect that triggers this event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.persistent_e.content: Triggers when a persistent effect is destroyed.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.actor_create.content: Triggers when the actor is created.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.actor_destro.content: Triggers when the actor is destroyed.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.actor_orphan.content: Triggers when the actor becomes orphaned. Actors become orphaned when their host actor is destroyed (an actor's host is typically the actor that created it).

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.animation_fi.content: Triggers when an animation on the actor finishes.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.AnimationTer.content: The animation that should trigger this event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.TimerTerm.na.content: The name of the timer that triggers this event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.on_custom_ev.content: Triggers when a [custom event](#send-custom-event) is recieved.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.CustomEvent..content: The name of the custom event that triggers this event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.beam_lost_ta.content: Triggers when the target of beam model actor is destroyed.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorTerm.beam_lost_la.content: Triggers when the launch of beam model actor is destroyed.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorEvent.conditions.content:
Conditions to be met for the actions to be executed. If any of the condition evaulates to 0, the actions will not be executed. Note that the condition will be evaulated in the context of an existing actor. If this event is used to create a new actor (e.g., create a actor when a certain behavior is turned on), the evaulation context will be the root of the actor scope (e.g., the unit actor). If no actor can be found, the conditions are assumed to be met.

In most cases, you want to use the [Compare](Data-ActorExpression#compare) condition.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorEvent.actions.content: Actions to run in response to an event, after conditions are checked. Actions that target other actors can only be sent to other actors of the same scope.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.play_anima.content:
Plays an animation on the actor.

GPU model animations can be previewed in the Asset Previewer.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.PlayAnimat.content: Which animation to play. The default animation is "Attack".

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.stop_anima.content: Stops playing an animation that was initiated by a [Play Animation](#play-animation) action.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.StopAnimat.content: Which animation to stop playing. The default animation is "Attack".

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.create.content:
Create a new actor in the scope of this actor.

The new actor should be a [Model Actor](Data-Actor-Model-Actor).

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.CreateActo.content: The type of new actor to create.
If set, this value will overwrite the **Host Site** field of the created actor.
If set, this value will overwrite the **Host Site Operations** field of the created actor.

Used to assign an **Alias** to the new actor.

An actor can be referenced by its name or any of its aliases.
When checked, prevents the created actor from following its source actor.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.destroy.content:
Destroys an actor.

If **Actor** is not set, the actor will destroy itself.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.DestroyAct.content: Look for an actor with this name within the scope to destroy.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.log.content: Prints a log message in the [Play Settings Log](Data-Play-Settings).

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.DebugLog.t.content:
Determines if the message is displayed as a debug, warning, or error message.

**DEBUG**:  The log message will use black text.

**WARNING**:  The log message will use yellow text.

**ERROR**:  The log message will use red text.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.create_tim.content: Creates a custom timer on the actor that triggers a [On Timer](#on-timer) event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.CreateTime.content: Name of the timer. This name is only defined in the scope of the current actor. You can use the same timer name in different actors and they won't interfere.

How soon the timer should expire (in seconds). After the timer is expired, an OnTimer event will be sent to the actor.

Note that actors are not bound by the 1/16 second game update, so any duration used here doesn't need to be a multiple of 0.0625.
By default a timer will be removed after it's expired. Set this flag to true will keep the timer and an OnTimer event will be fired every time when the time specified in "duration" has passed.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.remove_tim.content: Removes a timer without trigger an [On Timer](#on-timer) event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.RemoveTime.content: Name of the timer to remove. Note that a timer event may still be fired after removing the timer.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_site_o.content: Sets the [Site Operations](Data-Actor-Model-Actor#host-site-operations) of the actor. Note that unless **Append** is enabled, the new site operations will overwrite any existing site operations on the actor. **Duration** can be used to create simple animations.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetSiteOpe.content: The site operations to apply to the actor.
If set, the site operations will be applied over this duration. Does not work for all types of site operations.
If set, the new site operations will be added to the existing site operations on the actor instead of overwriting them. Does not work for all type sof site operations.

The easing function to use if the site operations are applied over a duration.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.create_ali.content:
Add aliases for an actor.

Applies an [alias](Data-Actor-Model-Actor#aliases) to the actor. If **Actor** is not set, the aliases will be applied to this actor.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.CreateAlia.content: The actor to apply the aliases to. Accepts an actor name or alias.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_variab.content: Sets a variable on the actor that can be checked by [Conditions](#conditions).

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetVariabl.content: The value of the variable. Most commonly set to a constant, random integer, or using add to increment the variable by a constant.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.send_custo.content: Sends a custom event that triggers an [On Custom Event](#on-custom-event) event. If **Actor** is not set, then the actor will send the custom event to itself. If the actor scope contains multiple actors with the targeted name or alias, only the first actor will recieve the event (See: [Broadcast Custom Event](#broadcast-custom-event)).

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SendCustom.content: The actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.
The name of the custom event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_tint_c.content: Sets the tint color of the actor. To clear tint color use ClearTintColor or set RGB to 255, 255, 255.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetTintCol.content: The actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.

These color values will be used to tint the model multiplicatively.

For example, a value of (0, 0, 255) will cause the model to lose all of its red and green colors, and become bright blue; a value of (128, 128, 1024) will weaken the model's red and green colors by half, and amplify the blue color by 400%.

dcei.engine.proto.PriorityLabel.label.content: Use labels to apply multiple tint colors. Only the current tint color with the highest priority will be used. Use ClearTintColor to remove tint color by label.

dcei.engine.proto.PriorityLabel.priority.content: Setting tint color with higher priority will overwrite any tint colors with lower priority. The default priority is 50.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetTintCol.content: If set, the tint color will be applied over this duration.

The easing function to use if the tint color is applied over a duration.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_mesh_e.content:
Applies a mesh effect to to the model, overriding any existing mesh effects.

It's recommended to use [Apply Mesh Effect](#apply-mesh-effect) instead as it doesn't override existing mesh effects.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetMeshEff.content: The actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.play_music.content: Used to set the game's music track.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.PlayMusic..content: Whether to save the previously playing music to a stack. This is useful if you want to resume that music later (using **Stop Music** with the pop flag set to true).

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.stop_music.content: Used to stop the game's music track.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.StopMusic..content: If set to true, will play the previously saved music. If not set, the music will simply stop.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.ShakeCamer.content: If no parameters are set, the default camera shake will be used.
The duration of the camera shake.
The magnitude of the camera shake.
The vibration intensity of the camera shake.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_visibi.content: Modifies the visibility of the actor. Hidden actors can't be selected or otherwise interact with the cursor.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetVisibil.content: The actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.
If disabled, hide the actor. If enabled, show the actor.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_model_.content:
The actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.

Sets the **[model scale](Data-Actor-Model-Actor#model-scale)** of the actor. The default model scale is 1.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetModelSc.content: The name of the actor that should receive the event. Can be aliases.
Adjusts the size of the model over a duration. Using model scale 0 defaults to 1.
The evaluated expression is added to the **Model Scale**.
If set, the scale will be applied over this duration. This can be used to make simple grow/shrink animations.

The easing function to use if the scale is applied over a duration.

The name of the custom event.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.apply_mesh.content: Applies a mesh effect to the actor. Mesh effects are similar to shaders effects.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.ApplyMeshE.content: The actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.remove_mes.content: Removes a mesh effect from the actor.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.RemoveMesh.content: The actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_team_c.content:
Applies colorization to specific sections of model's texture.

Currently only works with support models. Check the **Asset Previewer** to see which models support team color. Feel free to request more.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetTeamCol.content: The actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.

These color values will be used to colorize the team color sections of the model, using the A value as the blending value.

For example, a value of (0, 0, 255, 255) will set the team color to bright blue. Setting the A value to 0 means that no team color will be applied.
These color values will be used to colorize the secondary team color sections of the model.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_shadow.content:
Sets the shadow height of the actor.

Can be used to make shadows appear for models on cliffs.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetShadowH.content: The actor to set the shadow height for. Accepts an actor name or alias.
The value to set shadow height.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.play_anima.content: Similar to [Play Animation](#play-animation) but supports a duration for the animation.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.PlayAnimat.content: Which animation to play. The default animation is "Attack".

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.pause_anim.content: Used to pause a currently playing animation on the actor.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.PauseAnima.content: Which animation to pause. The default animation is "Attack".

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.resume_ani.content: Resumes a paused animation on the actor.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.ResumeAnim.content: Which animation to resume. The default animation is "Attack".

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.play_sound.content:
Used to play a sound from an actor directly.

The alternative is to create a separate sound actor.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.PlaySound..content: The name of the sound asset to play.
The volume multiplier for the sound. Using 0 defaults to 1.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_scale_.content: Sets the scale of the actor across individual axes. The final scale will be these values multiplied by the **Model Scale**.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetScaleMu.content: The name of the actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.
Specified the initial scale of the model and it can be non-uniform, this is display only, the finial display will multiply this by actual model scale
If set, the scale multiplier will be applied over this duration. This can be used to make simple grow/shrink animations.

The easing function to use if the scale multiplier is applied over a duration.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_shadow.content: Used to hide or show the shadow of an actor.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetShadow..content: The name of the actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.
When unchecked, hides the actor's shadow.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.clear_tint.content: Removes tint color from the actor.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.ClearTintC.content: The actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.
If set, only the tint with the matching label will be removed. Otherwise all tint color will be removed.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_outlin.content: Sets the outline render for the actor

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetOutline.content: The name of the actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.
Sets the outline color. The default is black.
The outline width to use. The default is 1.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.clear_outl.content: Clear the outline render for the actor

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.ClearOutli.content: The name of the actor that should receive the event. Accepts an actor name or alias.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_walk_a.content: Sets the walk animation for the actor

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetWalkAni.content: Which animation to play when unit is moving.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_idle_a.content: Sets the idle animation for the actor

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetIdleAni.content: Which animation to play when unit is idle.

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_dynami.content: Sets the cone angle and inner radius for dynamic AOEs

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetDynamic.content: The inner radius (as a fraction of the outer radius)

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.SetParticl.content: How long will the particle last?
How fast does the particle move when spawned?
A random color will be picked in between ColorA and ColorB

Sets the simulation speed of the entire particle system. Unlike SetStartSpeed which affects only the move speed of spawned particles (e.g., it does nothing if the spawned particles only rotate but not move), this makes everything move faster or slower. Default is 1.
Which subsystem this event should affect

dcei.engine.proto.ActorAction.set_model.content: Sets a new model for an actor, only sprite resources are supported for now

dcei.engine.proto.ActorExpressions.Expre.content:
Conditions to be met for the actions to be executed. If any of the condition evaulates to 0 or false, the actions will not be executed. 
Note that the condition will be evaulated in the context of an existing actor. If this event is used to create a new actor (e.g., create a actor when a certain behavior is turned on), the evaulation context will be the root of the actor scope (e.g., the unit actor). If no actor can be found, the conditions are assumed to be met.
Compares two values/expressions and returns true or false based on the result.
Returns the given integer. Useful for comparing to other values.
Returns the given variable. Variables are set with the **Set Variable** actor action.
Returns the sum of the listed expressions.
Returns the result of the evaluated expression if the condition is true. Otherwise returns false.
Returns a random integer between the min and max value.
Returns the result of the **left** value divided by the **right** value.
Returns the result of the listed expressions multiplied together.
Returns the result of the **right** value subtracted from the **left** value.
Returns the flipped value or expression (true becomes false, false becomes true).
Returns true if all listed values/expressions are true.
Returns true if any listed values/expressions are true.
If the actor is created by an **area search** effect from an **action actor**, returns the radius of the search effect.
If the actor scope contains a unit, returns the maximum range of a weapon on the unit.
If the actor scope contains a unit, returns the range of an ability on the unit.
If the actor scope contains a unit, returns the team id of the unit.
If the actor scope contains a unit, returns the current stack count of a behavior of the unit.
If the actor scope contains a unit, returns the radius of the unit.
Returns true if the actor event triggered by a critical hit.
Returns true if the current viewer has a certain alliance type with the unit in the actor scope.
Returns true if the current viewer has a certain player id.
If the actor event is triggered by **behavior_stack_increase** or **behavior_stack_decrease**, returns the stack count delta.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.content: Behaviors are usually buffs or debuffs that can be applied to units that modify the unit's attributes or how it acts. Behaviors can also apply tags and can function like custom attributes.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.default_stack.content: When the behavior's duration expires, it will remove a number of stacks as determined by "Stacks Removed on Expire".

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.DefaultStackT.content: If this is checked, the behavior's Duration will reset when subsequent stacks of the behavior are applied to the unit.
How many behavior stacks will be removed when the duration expires, 0 means all stacks will be removed. If duration expires but not all behavior stacks removed, the duration timer will be refreshed.
The effect created when subsequent stacks of a behavior are applied to a unit.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.independent_s.content: Each behavior stack will have its own duration.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.family.content: Used for filtering families of behaviors via behavior filter.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.alignment.content:
You can set this field to say whether a behavior is good, bad, neutral, or both for a unit. Does not affect gameplay in any way.

**NEUTRAL**:  Marks the behavior as neutral.

**POSITIVE**:  Marks the behavior as positive.

**NEGATIVE**:  Marks the behavior as negative.

**MIXED**:  Marks the behavior as both positive and negative.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.refresh_stack.content: If this is checked, the behavior's Duration will reset when subsequent stacks of the behavior are applied to the unit.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.max_stack_cou.content:
The maximum number of stacks a unit can have of this behavior.

Applying additional stacks beyond the maximum will not increase the stack count, but will refresh the duration if [Refresh Stack](#refresh-stack) is checked. 
A maximum stack count of 0 means that there is no limit to the number of copies allowed on a unit.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.update_durati.content: If this is checked and the behavior is disabled from a [Disable Validator](#Behavior-Validators-Disable), the behavior's [Duration](#duration) will continue to count down, rather than be paused.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.duration_rand.content: If set, a random value between 0 and the duration random addition will be added to behavior's the [Duration](#duration) when applied. A negative number will instead reduce the [Duration](#duration) in the same manner.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.unit_modifier.content: Modifications that are applied to the unit when the behavior is applied.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.UnitModifier..content: Used to change the owner of a unit. You typically want to use caster unit or source unit for charm behaviors.
Used to change the unit's AI behavior type.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.duration.content:
This is how long the behavior will last for.

By default, this duration is not reset when additional stacks are applied. All stacks are removed when the duration expires. A duration of 0 will result in the behavior lasting indefinitely.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.stacks_remove.content: How many behavior stacks will be removed when the duration expires, 0 means all stacks will be removed. If duration expires but not all behavior stacks removed, the duration timer will be refreshed.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.start_effect.content: The effect created when the behavior is started.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.final_effect.content: The effect created when the behavior is removed.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.refresh_effec.content:
The effect created when subsequent stacks of a behavior are applied to a unit.

Requires the [Refresh Stack](#refresh-stack) flag to be enabled.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.expire_effect.content:
The effect created when the behavior's duration expires.

This effect won't be executed if the behavior is removed via [Effect/Remove Behavior](Data-Effect-Remove-Behavior).

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.periodic_inte.content: Determines how often the Periodic Effect occurs. Must be greater than 0 to function to create periodic effects.
The evaluated expressions are added to the Periodic Interval.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.periodic_effe.content: The effect created a the end of each Periodic Interval.
Determines how many times the Periodic Effect is run. A periodic effect with count of -1 will last until the behavior is removed.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.behavior_vali.content: The behavior will only be applied if all of validators listed here succeed. Unlike Remove and Disable validators, these are only checked once.

The behavior will be removed if any of these validators succeed.

**NOTE:** these remove validators are checked every frame while the behavior is active and can cause significant CPU overhead. It's recommended to have less than 20 of such behaviors active at once.

The behavior will be disabled if any of these validators succeed. The behavior will be enabled again the next time that all of these validators fail.

**NOTE:** these disable validators are checked every frame while the behavior is active and can cause significant CPU overhead. It's recommended to have less than 20 of such behaviors active at once.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.modifiers.content: These modifiers can be applied to a number unit attributes (like health or movement speed) and different types of modifiers interact in different ways. Each modifier is applied once per stack of the behavior. Modifiers are only applied while the behavior is active.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorFlags.invulner.content:
Prevents damage taken.

Can be filtered by search filters such as in [Effect\AreaSearch](Data-Effect-Area-Search#filter).

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorFlags.stealth.content: Can be filtered by search filters. By itself stealth does not do anything.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorFlags.suppress.content: Prevents the unit from casting abilities.
Prevents the unit from interacting with or being affected by other unit's collision.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorFlags.ignore_p.content: Prevents the unit from being restricted to moving on the navmesh.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.unit.content:
Modifies the unit's target priority.

See: [Data/Unit/Target Priortity](Data-Unit#target-priority).

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.atta.content: Modifies the unit's weapon attack speed.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.weap.content: Modifies the unit's damage taken (from weapons).

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.abil.content: Modifies the unit's damage taken (from abilities).

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.crit.content: Modifies the unit's critical chance with weapons.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.abil.content: Modifies the unit's critical chance with abilities.
Modifies the gold cost of the unit's abilities.
Modifies the mana cost of the unit's abilities.
Modifies the health cost of the unit's abilities.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.heal.content: Modifies the unit's healing effects. Note that this modifier only applies to flat (non-percentage) healing effects.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.weap.content: Modifies the unit's weapon scan range.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.abil.content:
Modifies the unit's cooldown recharge speed.

Increases the speed of ability **cooldown** by this factor.
Setting **scaled** or **unscaled** to 1 will increase ability cooldown recharge speed to 200% (1.00 + 1.00 = 2.00), reducing the cooldown time by half.
Setting **additive**, **unified**, or **multiplier factor** to 1 will also increase ability cooldown recharge speed to 200% (1.00 * (1.00 + 1.00) = 2.00).

Modifies the unit's ability cast speed.

Increases the speed of ability **prep time**, **finish time**, and **cooldown** by this factor.
Setting **scaled** or **unscaled** to 1 will increase ability cast speed to 200% (1.00 + 1.00 = 2.00), reducing the total cast and cooldown time by half.
Setting **additive**, **unified**, or **multiplier factor** to 1 will also increase ability cast speed to 200% (1.00 * (1.00 + 1.00) = 2.00).

Modifies the unit's ability cooldown reduction.

This modifier only acts on ability **cooldown** and does not modify **prep time** or **finish time**.
To reduce ability cooldowns by 1 second, you could set the **scaled** or **unscaled** value to -1.
To reduce ability cooldowns by 50%, you could set the **additive**, **unified**, or **multiplier factor** to -0.5.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.disa.content: Prevents the unit from using these weapons.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.enab.content: Enables these weapons if they are disabled.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.disa.content: Prevents the unit from using weapons under these families.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.enab.content: Enables weapons under these families if they are disabled.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.weap.content: If set, modifiers affecting weapons (such as weapon damage, weapon range, attack speed, etc) only apply to weapons listed here rather than to all weapons.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.abil.content: If set, modifiers affecting abilities (such as ability damage, ability cooldown, ability speed, etc) only apply to abilities listed here rather than to all abilities.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.disa.content: Prevents the unit from using these abilities.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.enab.content: Enables these abilities if they are disabled.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.hide.content: Hide these abilities from the built-in UI.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.show.content: Show these abilities in the built-in UI if hidden.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.add_.content: Highlight these abilities in the built-in UI.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifiers.remo.content: Remove highlight from these abilities in the built-in UI.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.damage_respon.content: Allows the unit to create an effect or modify damage amounts in response to taking or dealing damage.

dcei.engine.proto.DamageResponse.chance.content: The chance that the damage response will occur. If 0, the damage response will never be triggered. If 1 the damage response will always be triggered.

dcei.engine.proto.DamageResponse.cooldow.content: The duration (in seconds) the damage response has to wait before it has a Chance of occurring again.

dcei.engine.proto.DamageResponse.locatio.content:
**DEFENDER**:  The damage response occurs when the unit takes damage.

**ATTACKER**:  The damage response occurs when the unit deals damage.

dcei.engine.proto.DamageResponse.fatal_o.content: If enabled, the damage response only occurs when taking or dealing fatal damage.

dcei.engine.proto.DamageResponse.effect.content: The effect is created when the damage response succeeds.

dcei.engine.proto.DamageResponse.damage_.content:
The damage that triggered the damage response is modified by these values when the damage response succeeds.

See [BehaviorModifier](#behaviormodifier) for how these values are calculated.

dcei.engine.proto.DamageResponse.validat.content: These validators must succeed when the damage response is triggered for the damage response to be executed.

dcei.engine.proto.DamageResponse.chance_.content:
Modifies the damage responses chance per stack of the behavior on the unit.

See [BehaviorModifier](#behaviormodifier) for how these values are calculated.

dcei.engine.proto.DamageResponse.damage_.content: If set, any damage below this amount will be adjusted to this amount when the damage response is triggered.
If set, any damage above this amount will be adjusted to this amount when the damage response is triggered.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.death_respons.content: Allows the unit to create an effect when it dies.

dcei.engine.proto.DeathResponse.chance.content: The chance that the death response will occur. If 0, the death response will never be triggered. If 1 the death response will always be triggered.

dcei.engine.proto.DeathResponse.effect.content:
The effect created by the death response.

[Target Type](#target-type) determines who it affects.

dcei.engine.proto.DeathResponse.target_t.content: The location where the death response occurs. In this context Caster/Source refers to the killing unit and Target refers to this unit.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.behavior_tag_.content: Used to have the behavior apply global tags to the unit. Tags can be referenced in validators and expressions.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.TagItem.name.content: The name of the tag to apply.

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.TagItem.count.content: The number of stacks of the tag to apply (per behavior stack).

dcei.engine.proto.Behavior.locked.content: Disables the behavior. Used by Wild Sky to allow behaviors to be enabled by contextual loading.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifier.content:
The total result of all modifiers for an attribute follows this formula:
> ```CSS
>  result = (value + sum(scaled))
>           * (1 + sum(additive_factor))
>           * (1 + positive(max(unified_factor)) + negative(min(unified_factor)))
>           * (1 + multiplier_factor[1]) *  (1 + multiplier_factor[2])
>           + sum(unscaled).
>  ```
>

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifier.scale.content: The value is added to the base value, and can be multiplied by additive, unified, or multiplier factors.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifier.unsca.content: The value is added to the base value but are never multiplied by additive, unified, or multiplier factors.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifier.addit.content:
Increases the base value as a multiplier.

When multiple sources of additive factors are applied, they combine additively (Ex: `+0.5` + `+0.25` = `+0.75`).

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifier.unifi.content:
Increases the base value as a multiplier.

When multiple sources of unified factors are applied, only the highest positive value and lowest negative value are used (Ex: `+0.5` + `+0.25` = `+0.5`).

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorModifier.multi.content:
Increases the base value as a multiplier.

When multiple sources of multiplier factors are applied, they combine multiplicatively (Ex: `+0.5` + `+0.25` = `+0.875`).

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAddGold.amount.content: The amount of gold to add.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAddGold.target.content: Which unit's owner to give gold to. Using NONE defaults to TARGET_UNIT. NONE is TARGET_UNIT

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAddGold.display_.content: If checked, will create UI ingame when the effect is created.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.apply_behavior.content: Applies a Behavior to a unit.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectApplyBehavior.ta.content: Which unit to apply the behavior to. Using NONE defaults to TARGET_UNIT. NONE is TARGET_UNIT

dcei.engine.proto.EffectApplyBehavior.st.content: The number of behavior stacks to apply. If set to 0, 1 stack count will be added.
The evaluated [expressions](Data-Expression) will be added to the effect's [Stack Count](#stack-count).

dcei.engine.proto.EffectApplyBehavior.du.content: If set, this will be used instead of the behavior's duration.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectApplyBehavior.ex.content: If checked, the duration will be added to the existing behavior on the target.
The evaluated [expressions](Data-Expression) will be added to the effect's [Duration](#duration).

dcei.engine.proto.EffectApplyBehavior.re.content: If checked, the effects created by the applied behavior will use the caster of this effect as the caster reference. By default, behaviors will use their target unit as the caster reference. This is useful for making colliding projectiles that deal damage using a damage expression that references behaviors or tags on the caster.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.apply_simple_mo.content: Apply a simple mover to a simple unit

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.apply_tag.content:
Applies a local Tag to a unit within the given effect tree. Tags are arbitrary counters that can be referenced by Expressions and Validators

This can be used to prevent periodic search effect from damaging a unit multiple times by excluding it from future searches when combined with a validator.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectApplyTag.duratio.content: The duration of the tag. Use -1 to make the duration infinite.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectApplyTag.stack_c.content: The number of stacks of the tag to apply.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.area_search.content: Searches an area and applies effects to found targets.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.debug.content:
When checked, shows the area of this search effect in-game.

Useful for debugging effects.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.dista.content: Determines whether to consider unit radius or center point when finding targets.
Determines whether to extend the search radius by the source unit's radius.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.area_.content: Determines whether to search in a circle, arc, rectangle, or the source unit's children units.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.max_u.content: The maximum number of units that will be found by the search.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.caste.content: Whether to automatically include or exclude the effect caster.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.sourc.content: Whether to automatically include or exclude the effect source.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.targe.content: Whether to automatically include or exclude the effect target.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.filte.content: Parameters for which targets are valid for the search.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.valid.content:
Targets must pass these validators to be considered valid targets.

See: [Data/Validator](Data-Validator).

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.requi.content: If set, units must have these tags to be considered valid targets.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.exclu.content: If set, units with these tags will be excluded from the search.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.effec.content: The effect created on targets found by the search.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.missi.content: This effect is created if the number of targets found is less than the Max Unit Count (if set). This effect is created for each missing target. Ex: if the Max Unit Count is 3 but only 1 target is found, then the Effect will executed once on the target and the Missing Effect will be executed twice at the search location.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.repea.content: When set, targets found by this search effect will be excluded from other instances of this search effect within its effect tree for the duration. This is useful for making abilities with overlapping search effects where you only want to hit each target once.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.use_s.content: If checked, the search's facing will be set to the source unit's facing (before facing adjustment is applied).

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.facin.content: The angle to offset the search's facing by.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.offse.content: Used in combination with Offset End to determine the facing of this effect. If both are set to a unit, the effect will use that unit's facing.
Used in combination with Offset Start to determine the facing of this effect. If both are set to a unit, the effect will use that unit's facing.
The offset coordinates for this effect.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.attach_unit.content:
Attach two units.

You can useAttachUnit to attach a ["Simple"](https://funovus.notion.site/Simple-Units-Introduction-8a39c47f07d64f4c9549c5947c2c281f) unit to a "Normal" unit. It's bridge for Simple/Complex units working together.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAttachUnit.use_c.content: When set, child unit will use it's own rotation instead of locked to host's rotation.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAttachUnit.attac.content: Offset between the parent and child unit.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAttachUnit.Attac.content:
Sets the orientation the offset is relative to.

**PARENT_ORIENTATION**:  Orientation is relative to the direction from parent unit's facing.

**WORLD_ORIENTATION**:  Orientation is relative to world facing (i.e., north).

dcei.engine.proto.EffectConsumeMana.amou.content: The amount of mana to consume.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectConsumeMana.targ.content: Which unit to consume mana from. Using NONE defaults to TARGET_UNIT. NONE is TARGET_UNIT

dcei.engine.proto.EffectDamage.which_uni.content: Which unit to apply damage to.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectDamage.damage_am.content: The amount of damage to deal.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectDamage.expressio.content:
The result of each expression listed here will be evaluated and added to the damage amount. The total damage amount will then be passed through any behavior modifiers or damage responses.

See: [Data/Expression](Data-Expression).
Note that the expression's [Value/DamageAmount](Data-Expression#damage-amount) refers to the Damage Amount of this effect.
The damage value after behavior modifiers are applied will be used when evaulating this expression and the combined value will be used to further apply damage responses.
The damage value after damage responses are applied will be used when evaluating this expression and the result will be added to the damage value.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectDamage.card_name.content: Name of the card this damage effect is associated with. Used for reporting in-game stats.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectDetachUnit.which.content: Which unit to detach from parent.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.disengage.content:
Disengages a unit. Units with TD AI behaviors can become engaged (locked in combat) with enemy units and ignore waypoint movement.

This effect is used to remove engagement. The disengage effect can also be used to make a unit lose its current weapon target, which can be useful in some non-TD cases.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectDisengage.locati.content: Which unit to disengage. If set to none, target unit will be used.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.enumerate_unit_.content: Uses a search effect to generate a list of units and runs effects on units in the list.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectEnumerateUnitLis.content: Used to determine the ability target type if this effect is the first effect of an ability.

Determines how to iterate through the unit list.

[Step Count](#step-count)
[validator](#validator)
[Impact Effect](#impact-effect)

**REPEAT**:  For each Step Count, check the validator and run the Impact Effect on the top unit of the list. If the validator fails, remove the top unit from the list and move on to the next unit in the list.

**FALL_THROUGH**:  For each Step Count, check the validator and run the Impact Effect on the next unit in the list. The unit list is iterated through in sequence.
When checked, the list will be iterated through on repeat until the step count is exhausted or no valid targets remain.
The number of times to run the impact effect.
The evaluated [expressions](Data-Expression) are added to [Step Count](#step-count).
The [validator](Data-Validator) checked before running the [Impact Effect](#impact-effect). If the validator fails, the effect is not executed and the step is not counted.

The [Area Search](Data-Effect-Area-Search) effect used to generate the unit list. Typically this search should not have Effect or Missing Effect as it should only be used to generate a list of potential targets for the Enumerate Unit List effect.
This effect is created if the number of units found by the [Search Effect](#search-effect) is less than the [Step Count](#step-count). This effect is created for each missing target.
The effect run on the unit list each step that the [validator](#validator) passes.

If this is set, for the current iteration, the target of previous iteration will be used as the source for this iteration. E.g. Chain lighting

Used in combination with [Use Target Location](#location-mode) to update the search location (useful for creating chain lighting effects).

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.force.content: Applies a force to units in a target area.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.location.content: Determines where the force effect is created. - If unit, the force effect will move along with the unit. If the associated unit is removed, the force effect will stay at its last position. - If location, the force effect will be created at that location. - If unit or location, unit will be selected first if available and if not location will be used.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.offset_sta.content: Used in combination with Offset End to determine the facing of this effect. If start & end is the same unit, the facing of that unit is used; if start & end is at the same point, facing of the source unit is used as a fallback and if source is not an unit, facing of the caster unit is used.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.offset_end.content: Used in combination with Offset Start to determine the facing of this effect.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.world_faci.content: When checked, the effect will ignore Offset Start/End and instead use world grid facing.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.facing_adj.content: Offset in degrees added (clockwise) to the effect's facing.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.search_are.content: The target area that will be affected by the force.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.search_fil.content: Parameters for which units are affected by the force.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.duration.content: How long the effect lasts in seconds.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.duration_e.content: Any expressions here will be evaluated and added to the **duration** when the force effect is created.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.speed.content: The distance to travel per second for units affected by the force.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.speed_expr.content: Any expressions here will be evaluated and added to the **speed** when the force effect is created.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.validators.content: If set, only targets pass these validators will be affected by the force.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.debug_draw.content: When checked, shows the area of this force effect in-game.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectHeal.value_type.content: Whether to heal a percentage of the target's health or an explicit amount.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectHeal.expressions.content: The evaluated [expressions](Data-Expression) are added to the heal amount.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectHeal.card_name.content: Name of the card this heal effect is associated with. Used for reporting in-game stats.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.issue_ability.content: Orders a unit to cast an ability.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectIssueAbility.one.content: Determines whether ability is referenced by name or tag.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectIssueAbility.abi.content: Which unit to issue an ability order to.
Which unit should be the target of the ability.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectIssueAbility.ign.content: If checked, the ability won't use cost or cooldown when casting.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.issue_command.content: Issues move or attack commands to a unit.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectIssueCommand.typ.content:
**NONE**:  

**MOVE_TO_LOCATION**:  The unit will be ordered to move to the location.

**ATTACK_TO_LOCATION**:  The unit will be ordered to attack move to the location.

**ATTACK_UNIT**:  The unit will be ordered to attack the target unit.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectIssueCommand.whi.content: Which unit to give the move or attack order to.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectIssueCommand.tar.content: Which unit to attack when using **Attack Unit**.
Which location to use when using **Move To Location** or **Attack To Location**.
Offset used for the target location if type is location.

Offset start & end together determines the orientation of the offset.
If offset start & end are both specified but are overlapping, and the offset start is an unit (e.g., caster unit), the facing of that unit will be used.
If offset start & end are not specified, or specified but cannot determine the facing using the above rules, the commanded unit's facing will be used.
Used in combination with Offset Start to determine the facing of this effect. If both are set to a unit, the effect will use that unit's facing.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.launch_missile.content: Launches a missile unit at a target unit or location.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.ta.content: Determines the target type for the effect.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.mi.content: The type of Unit used as a missile. If set to **None**, the unit specified in launch location will be used (typically caster or target, useful to create knockback effects).

Determines what happens to the missile unit on impact.

**IMPACT**:  The missile unit will be removed on impact.

**NONE**:  The missile unit will persist after impact (useful for knockback effects).

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.st.content: The effect created when the missile is launched.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.im.content: The effect created when the missile impacts its target.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.la.content: Where the missile will be launched from.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.of.content:
Offset start & end together determines the "facing" of this effect. This facing will be used to interpret offsets and also will be used as the initial facing of the created missile unit.
If offset start & end are both set to non-none values and the specified locations don't overlap, the effect will face from start to end.
If offset start & end are both specified but are overlapping, and the offset start is an unit (e.g., caster unit), the facing of that unit will be used.
If offset start & end are not specified, or specified but cannot determine the facing using the above rules, the facing will be determined by launch & impact location instead using the same rules as above.
Used in combination with Offset Start to determine the facing of this effect. If both are set to a unit, the effect will use that unit's facing.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.la.content: The offset coordinates for the missile's launch location. Offsets are relative to the effect's facing.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.im.content: The offset coordinates for the missile's impact location. Offsets are relative to the effect's facing.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.us.content: When checked, the missile unit's height will be considered when when calculating the impact location.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.mi.content: The effect applied to the missile when it's created.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.mo.content: The mover that determines how the missile will travel.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.ar.content: Tie a Search effect to a missile unit, which will apply every update

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.si.content: Tie a Simple Search Effect to a missile unit, which will apply every update

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.ar.content: This flag specifies if the Missile counts as "HitTarget" (reached it's destination) if the missile "Search Effect" finds a target.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.dy.content: If set, if the search effect is a rectangular search, the length will automatically extend to make sure there are no gaps in the search radiuses, based on the speed of the projectile.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectLaunchMissile.un.content: If set, this search effect will only impact a target once per source. E.g., enabling this would prevent a target from being hit multiple times from different instances of a search effect originating from a single missile.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectModifyUpgradeLev.content: Any expressions here will be evaluated and added to the **level** when the effect is created.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.modify_unit.content: Modifies properties on a unit such as mana, shield, or ability cooldown.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.morph_troop.content: Similar to Morph effect but retains unit parent-child relationship.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectMorphTroop.targe.content: The type of unit to morph into.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.morph.content: Turns a unit into another unit type.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectMorph.target_uni.content: The type of unit to morph into.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.persistent.content:
Creates and sequences additional effects.

Can be used to create multiple effects over time and/or with offsets.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectPersistent.perio.content: The number of periodic effects to create.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectPersistent.start.content: The effect created when the persistent is created, before the periodic effects.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectPersistent.final.content: The effect created when the persistent ends, after the periodic effects.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectPersistent.locat.content:
Determines where the persistent effect is created. - If unit, the persistent effect will move along with the unit and effects created by the persistent will use the unit as the source. If the associated unit is removed, the persistent effect will stay at its last position. - If location, the persistent effect will be created at that location and effects created will use the location as their source. - If unit or location, unit will be selected first if available and if not location will be used.

If set to unit, but the unit doesn't exist (e.g. use `Target Unit` but the effect's target is a position), the persistent effect won't be created.
