If set to location, but the the target is actually a unit (e.g. use `Target Location` but the effect's target is a unit), the unit's position will be used.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectPersistent.offse.content: Used in combination with Offset End to determine the facing of this effect. If start & end is at the same point, facing of the source unit is used as a fallback and if source is not an unit, facing of the caster unit is used.

Used in combination with Offset Start to determine the facing of this effect. If start & end is at the same point, facing of the source unit is used as a fallback and if source is not an unit, facing of the caster unit is used.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectPersistent.start.content: Offset coordinates for the start effect. Offsets are relative to the effect's facing.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectPersistent.final.content: Offset coordinates for the final effect. Offsets are relative to the effect's facing.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectPersistent.world.content: When checked, the persistent will ignore Offset Start/End and instead use world grid facing. This is useful for certain game types such as an arcade shooter where projectiles always travel up.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectPersistent.perio.content: Determines how the periodic duration, effect, or offset is selected.
Determines how the periodic duration, effect, or offset is selected.
The effects to run at the end of each period.
Determines how the periodic duration, effect, or offset is selected.
The offset used to create the periodic effects. Uses the effect's facing to determine offset facing.

All validators listed are checked each period and the periodic effect is only executed if all validators succeed.

See: [Data/Validator](Data-Validator).

dcei.engine.proto.EffectPersistent.termi.content: If checked, the persistent effect will be destroyed the first time the periodic validators succeed. The final effect will be executed when the persistent is terminated.
If checked, the persistent effect will be destroyed the first time the periodic validators fail. The final effect will be executed when the persistent is terminated.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.remove_behavior.content: Removes a Behavior from a unit.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectRemoveBehavior.t.content: Which unit to remove the behavior from. Using NONE defaults to TARGET_UNIT. NONE is TARGET_UNIT

dcei.engine.proto.EffectRemoveBehavior.s.content: How many stacks to remove. If set to 0, the behavior will be removed regardless of the existing stack count.
The evaluated [expressions](Data-Expression) will be added to the effect's [Stack Count](#stack-count).

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.remove_tag.content: Removes one count of a local Tag within the given effect tree.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectRemoveTag.stack_.content: The number of stacks of the tag to remove. If set to 0, the tag will be removed regardless of the existing stack count.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.remove.content:
Removes a unit from the game.

Note that this will immediately remove and destroy the unit's actor, unless the actor has the [Preserve On Unit Remove](Data-Actor-Unit-Actor#preserve-on-unit-remove) flag enabled. Removing a unit does not trigger on-death effects (such as triggers, damage response behaviors, or deatg response behaviors.)

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.sell.content: Destroys a unit and refunds the cost to the owner.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSell.value_type.content: Whether to refund a percentage of the target's cost or an explicit amount.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSell.refund.content: The amount of gold to refund. If using percentage, 0.5 means 50%.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSell.unit_cost_o.content: If checked, ignores modifications to the unit's cost from abilities (such as from [Abilities/Add To Unit Cost](Data-Ability#add-to-unit-cost)).

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.set_bounty_.content: Sets the amount of gold a unit drops when it's killed.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSetBounty.which_.content: Which unit to apply the bounty to.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSetBounty.amount.content: The amount of gold for the unit to drop when killed.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.set_rally_point.content: Sets the rally point for child units, such as TD_Troop spawned via [Effects/Spawn Troop](Data-Effect-Spawn-Troop).

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSetRallyPoint.wh.content: Which unit to set rally point. For barracks tower, this should be the tower.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSetRallyPoint.lo.content: The location of the new rally point on the ground to set to.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.set_waypoints.content: Sets the waypoint path for TD_Creep or Generic Controllable units.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSetWaypoints.tar.content: Which unit to set waypoints for.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSetWaypoints.way.content: Which method is used for setting waypoints.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSetWaypoints.dis.content: Sets the waypoints offset across the lane width (0 = left edge, 1 = right edge).
A random number between this and 0 will be added to the dispersal offset.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSetWaypoints.use.content: If checked, determine dispersal automatically from unit's current position.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSetWaypoints.ign.content: When checked, lanes marked as "Disable Rally" as valid waypoints.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSet.target_type.content: Used to determine the ability target type if this effect is the first effect of an ability.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSet.effect_list.content: The set of effects to create. Effects are executed in order from top to bottom.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.simple_area_sea.content:
Searches an area and applies effects to found simple units.

For more info about simple units, see [Simple Units Guide.](https://funovus.notion.site/Simple-Units-Introduction-8a39c47f07d64f4c9549c5947c2c281f)

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleAreaSearch.content: When checked, shows the area of this search effect in-game.
Determines whether to search in a circle, arc, rectangle, or the source unit's children units.
The maximum number of units that will be found by the search.
Parameters for which targets are valid for the search.

dcei.engine.proto.SimpleSearchFilter.pri.content: Potential targets are sorted based on these parameters.

dcei.engine.proto.SimpleSearchFilter.sec.content: If a pair of targets have the same priority value due to Primary Sort Keys, this sort key is then used to determine which unit to target.

dcei.engine.proto.SimpleSearchFilter.pla.content: Targets owned by the player that created the search will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SimpleSearchFilter.all.content: Targets owned by an ally of the player that created the search will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SimpleSearchFilter.ene.content: Targets owned by an enemy of the player that created the search will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SimpleSearchFilter.neu.content: Targets that are neutral to the player that created the search will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SimpleSearchFilter.is_.content: Targets that are simple units will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SimpleSearchFilter.has.content: Targets that have simple health components will match the filter.
Targets that have simple collision components will match the filter.
Targets that have simple mover components will match the filter.
Targets that have simple mass components will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleAreaSearch.content: Determines whether to consider unit radius or center point when finding targets.
The effect created on targets found by the search.

This effect is created if the number of targets found is less than the Max Unit Count (if set). This effect is created for each missing target. Ex: if the Max Unit Count is 3 but only 1 target is found, then the Effect will executed once on the target and the Missing Effect will be executed twice at the search location.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.simple_damage.content:
Deal damage to simple unit targets

For more info about simple units, see [Simple Units Guide.](https://funovus.notion.site/Simple-Units-Introduction-8a39c47f07d64f4c9549c5947c2c281f)

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleDamage.dam.content: The amount of damage to target.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleDamage.sty.content: Index of the registered simple damage number style that would be used for this damage

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.simple_force.content:
Force a simple unit or normal unit to move horizontally or

For more info about simple units, see [Simple Units Guide.](https://funovus.notion.site/Simple-Units-Introduction-8a39c47f07d64f4c9549c5947c2c281f)

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleForce.forc.content: Force direction is from this location to target unit location

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleForce.hori.content: Positive value push targets away, negative values pull targets closer
Horizontal force will be subtracted by this value per second

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleForce.vert.content: Positive value lift targets up, negative values drag targets down
Vertical force will be subtracted by this value per second

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleForce.dura.content: How long this effect lasts in seconds

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleForce.only.content: When checked, this force will only trigger if the target is killed in the same frame

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.simple_movement.content:
Applies a movement speed modifier to a simple unit

For more info about simple units, see [Simple Units Guide.](https://funovus.notion.site/Simple-Units-Introduction-8a39c47f07d64f4c9549c5947c2c281f)

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleMovementSp.content: How long the modifier will last in seconds

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.simple_spawn_ar.content: Spawn a simple unit around an anchor unit

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleSpawnAroun.content: Orientation of the newly spawned unit, rotation in eular angle format
Effect to apply on newly spawned unit Must be an effect that supports simple units
Position offset in the anchor unit local coordinate

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.simple_spawn.content: Spawn a simple unit around an anchor unit

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleSpawn.effe.content: Effect to apply on newly spawned unit Must be an effect that supports simple units

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.simple_vertical.content: Lift or drop simple units or normal units

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSimpleVerticalFo.content: Positive value lifts target up, negative value pulls target down
Force will be subtracted by this value per second
How long this effect lasts in seconds
Only trigger this force effect when target is killed in the same frame

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.spawn_troop.content: Creates units as children of the caster. Note that this is generally for use within Wild Sky TD and interacts with TD-specific AI behaviors.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawnTroop.unit.content: The type of unit to create.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawnTroop.spawn.content: The number of units to create.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawnTroop.max_c.content: If set, only up to this number of units will be created.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawnTroop.offse.content: The offset for where the unit is created.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawnTroop.spawn.content: If checked, will create the units at the parent's rally point rather than the parent's location.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawn.unit.content: The type of unit to create.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawn.count.content: The number of units to create.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawn.owner.content: Which unit's owner will be the owner for the spawned units.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawn.owner_id.content: If specified (i.e., non-zero), this field will be used instead of the "owner" field.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawn.location.content: Determines the position and facing of the spawned unit. If the specified location is not an unit, spawned units use the default facing (0).

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawn.offset_sta.content:
Offset start & end together determines the "facing" of this effect. This facing will be used to interpret offsets and also will be used as the initial facing of the created missile unit.
If offset start & end are both set to non-none values and the specified locations don't overlap, the effect will face from start to end.
If offset start & end are both specified but are overlapping, and the offset start is an unit (e.g., caster unit), the facing of that unit will be used.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawn.offset_end.content: Used in combination with Offset Start to determine the facing of this effect. If both are set to a unit, the effect will use that unit's facing.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawn.offset.content: Offset relative to the facing of the created unit.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawn.facing_off.content: Additional facing offset applied to the created unit. Note that this facing will be applied after position offset facing is applied.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawn.effect.content: Effect applied to the spawned unit after they are spawned.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSpawn.spawn_on_n.content: If checked, the unit will be spawned at the nearest pathable location if the target location isn't pathable.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.stop.content: Makes a unit stop moving and clears its current attack target.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.switch_effect.content: Run different effects based on validators/conditions.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSwitch.target_ty.content: Used to determine the ability target type if this effect is the first effect of an ability.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSwitch.cases.content: For each case (from top to bottom), check the Validator and execute the effect if the Validator succeeds. By default the switch ends when the first Validator passes.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSwitch.EffectCas.content: The effect to run if the validator passes.
If checked, the next case will be evaluated even if this case passes.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.teleport_along_.content:
Teleport a unit along its waypoint path.

Note that this only works with units with waypoints, such as Generic Controllable that have been given waypoints with [Effect/Set Waypoints](Data-Effect-Set-Waypoints).

dcei.engine.proto.EffectTeleportAlongWay.content: Distance along waypoints to teleport a unit.
Any expressions here will be evaluated and added to the **distance** when the teleport along waypoint effect is created.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectTeleport.to.content: Where to teleport the unit to.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectTeleport.offset_.content:
Offset start & end together determines the offset forward, right and up directions.
If start & end are same unit, forward direction will be that unit's orientation. If start & end are using target unit but effect is casted on target location, offset will be ignored. If start & end are different units, forward direction will be start--->end
Used in combination with Offset Start to determine the facing of this effect. If both are set to a unit, the effect will use that unit's facing.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.content:
Effects are the building blocks of abilities and weapons and can be used to launch missiles, perform searches, deal damage, and the like. Effects can be chained together to create complex ability sequences.
For example to create a fireball abilities that explodes and deals damage in an area, you can create an effect tree such as **Launch Missile** > **Area Search** > **Damage**. The effects can be configured so that the **Launch Missile** effect creates an **Area Search** on impact, which runs a **Damage** effect on enemy units within a small radius.
# Effect Locations
Some effects have a [Location](Data-Effect-Persistent#location) field which determines where the effect is created. For effects that can only occur on a unit (such as Damage or Apply Behavior) this field may be called [Which Unit]((Data-Effect-Damage#which-unit)) or [Target]((Data-Effect-Apply-Behavior#target)). Regardless of whether the target type is a unit or location, where the effect is created follows the same general semantics.
### Unit
If the target type is unit and the specified unit isn't found, then the effect won't be executed.
* **Target Unit**: The target unit of the previous effect, weapon, ability, or behavior.
* **Source Unit**: The last unit involved in the effect tree (a previous target, spawned unit, or missile).
* **Caster Unit**: The first unit involved in the effect tree (typically the unit that used the weapon or ability).
### Location
If the target type is location but the target happens to be a unit, then the location of the unit will be used instead.
* **Target Location**: The target location of the previous effect, weapon, ability, or behavior.
* **Source Location**: The location of the previous effect in the effect tree.
* **Caster Location**: The location of first unit involved in the effect tree.
### Unit or Location
If the target type is unit or location, it will look for a unit first before falling back to a location.
* **Target Unit or Location**: The target unit/location of the previous effect, weapon, ability, or behavior.
* **Source Unit or Location**: The last unit/effect location in the effect tree.
* **Caster Unit or Location**: The first unit/location involved in the effect tree.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.debug_log_conte.content: When checked, prints the effect's caster/source/target info to the log.

dcei.engine.proto.Effect.universal_field.content: Universal Field Expressions allow you to set an expression for most fields in effects even when they wouldnt ordinarily accept an expression. [See notion guide "Universal Field Expressions"](https://www.notion.so/funovus/Universal-Field-Expressions-1c8388c126e14bff83c1944ddbf8aea1)

dcei.engine.proto.ValidatorExpressions.E.content:
Expressions are a powerful feature of the DreamEditor that allows you to write formulas and plug them into various fields of game data. They're useful for creating things like damage formulas, where certain weapon types (fire, nature, armored) will deal more or less damage to different "armor" types (water, earth, light) as arbitrarily defined with tags. [See notion guide "Using Expressions."](https://www.notion.so/funovus/Using-Expressions-96418b963c274b5daa4e88ccab846d40)
Similar to [Validators](Data-Validator), expressions are evaluated and return a result. Expressions are more flexible as they can be configured to write user defined formulas, and unlike validators they can return numeric or boolean values depending on context. 
In numeric cases, true is treated as `1` and false is treated as `0`. In boolean cases, non-zero numbers are treated as `true` and 0 is treated as `false`. Note that expressions can also be used as [validators](Data-Validator#expression).
The most common use case for expressions are for creating custom damage formulas, such as `damage = ([caster]STRENGTH * 10) - [target]ARMOR)`, where `STRENGTH` and `ARMOR` are arbitrary attributes defined as [tags](Data-Behavior#behavior-tag-array).
**Supported Fields**
Expressions can be plugged into a number of existing data fields and can also be used with data binding in [custom UI](Trigger-API-Reference-DCEI-Functions-Custom-UI#void-settextframetextexpressiontransform-text-string-content). These are the currently supported data fields:
- [Behavior/PeriodicInterval](Data-Behavior#periodic-interval-expressions)
- [Effect/ApplyBehavior/Duration](Data-Effect-Apply-Behavior#expressions)
- [Effect/Damage/DamageAmount](Data-Effect-Damage#expressions)
- [Effect/EnumerateUnitList/StepCount](Data-Effect-Enumerate-Unit-List#step-count-expressions)
- [Effect/Heal/HealAmount](Data-Effect-Heal#expressions)
- [Effect/ModifyUnit/ModifyMana/Amount](Data-Effect-Modify-Unit#modify-mana)
- [Effect/ModifyUnit/ModifyShield/Amount](Data-Effect-Modify-Unit#modify-shield)
- [Mover/Orbiting/Radius](Data-Mover-Orbiting#datamoverorbiting)
As of version 0.10.x and up, [Effects](Data-Effect) now have a universal field expression section where you can overwrite any numeric effect field with an expression by specifying its field path. The expression will be evaluated right before the effect is cast using the same caster/source/target info as passed to the effect itself.
These are the types of values you can include or reference in expression formulas.

dcei.engine.proto.ValidatorExpressions.V.content: Returns a constant value.

dcei.engine.proto.ValidatorExpressions.C.content: Returns a floating point number (with decimal).

dcei.engine.proto.ValidatorExpressions.V.content: Returns a random number between the min and max value.

dcei.engine.proto.ValidatorExpressions.R.content: Returns a floating point number (with decimal).

dcei.engine.proto.ValidatorExpressions.V.content:
The damage amount is multiplied by this value (default 0).

Returns the literal [damage value](Data-Effect-Damage#damage-amount) when used within a [damage effect](Data-Effect-Damage#expressions).

The heal amount is multiplied by this value (default 0).

Returns the literal [heal value](Data-Effect-Heal#heal-amount) when used within a [heal effect](Data-Effect-Heal#expressions).
Returns the tag count of a specific [tag](Data-Behavior#behavior-tag-array) on a unit.
Returns the [level](Data-Unit#level-unused) of a unit. Currently limited in usefulness.
Returns the [level](Data-Ability#level-unused) of an ability. Currently limited in usefulness.
Returns the level of a wild sky upgrade.
Returns the level of an upgrade.
Returns the remaining path distance for a unit with [waypoints](Data-Effect-Set-Waypoints).
Returns the current cooldown remaining for an ability.

dcei.engine.proto.ValidatorExpressions.U.content: When checked, the expression returns the total cooldown duration, rather than time remaining.

dcei.engine.proto.ValidatorExpressions.V.content: Returns the current health of a unit.
Returns the max health of a unit.
Returns the current health fraction of a unit.
Returns the current mana of a unit.
Returns the max mana of a unit.
Returns the current mana fraction of a unit.
Returns the current shields of a unit.
Returns the max shields of a unit.
Returns the current shield fraction of a unit.
Returns the current stack count of a behavior on a unit.

Returns the elapsed time that a behavior has been on a unit.

Note that this duration is reset to 0 when the stack count is [refreshed](Data-Behavior#refresh-stack).

Returns the duration that a behavior has been on a unit.

Returns the maximum [duration](Data-Behavior#duration) of a behavior on a unit. Note that this duration is not extended when the stack count is [refreshed](Data-Behavior#refresh-stack).

Returns the sum of the listed expressions.

Functionally similar to [Add](#add) but used as an expression value rather than a top-level operator.

Returns 1 if the effect tree is the result of a critical hit with a [weapon](Data-Weapon#critical-effect) or [ability](Data-Ability#critical-effect).
This can be used to create [damage expressions](Data-Effect-Damage#expressions) that deal increased damage on critical hits. For example this psuedo-expression would cause a damage effect to deal 150% damage on critical hit. 
```
Multiply( EffectCrticial * DamageAmount(1) * Constant(0.5) )
```
Swap out the constant for value derived from [tag count]((#tag-count)) to support dynamic critical hit damage multipliers.
Returns the distance between units.

dcei.engine.proto.ValidatorExpressions.E.content: Multiply multiple values together. Supports nested expressions.
Add multiple values together. Supports nested expressions.
Compares two values/expressions and returns true or false based on the result.
Returns the flipped value or expression (true becomes false, false becomes true).
Returns true if all listed values/expressions are true.
Returns true if any listed values/expressions are true.
Used to reference another [expression](#dataexpression). This is useful for combining multiple expressions or breaking complex expressions into smaller abstractions.
Returns value to the [power](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exponentiation) of another. Similar to the `^` operator in Lua.
Returns the [remainder](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modulo_operation) of a value after being divided by another. Similar to the `%` operator in Lua.
Returns the sum of the **Values** expressions if the **Compare** condition returns true. Otherwise returns the same of the **Else Values** expressions.

dcei.engine.proto.Mover.ballistic.content:
Moves the missile unit in a parabolic arc (like a thrown grenade).

Note that the ballistic mover can use **flight time** or **speed** but not both.

dcei.engine.proto.Mover.guidance.content: Moves the missile unit linearly towards the target with tracking (like a guided missile).

dcei.engine.proto.Mover.multi_stage.content: A mover with multiple stages and motion overlays.

dcei.engine.proto.MultiStageMover.MoverS.content: If set, the time in seconds after entering this stage to start to transition to the next stage. If neither exit_time nor exit_distance is set, the current stage will last indefinitely.
If set, the travel distance after entering this stage to start to transition to the next stage. If neither exit_time nor exit_distance is set, the current stage will last indefinitely.

If set, the time in seconds to blend the current stage and the next stage while transitioning. If both transition_time and transition_distance are 0, the transition to the next stage will finish instantly.

If set, the travel distance to blend the current stage and the next stage while transitioning. If both transition_time and transition_distance are 0, the transition to the next stage will finish instantly.
The intensity of each motion overlay in this stage. It should have the same number of entries as the number of overlays. Missing entries are treated as 0.

dcei.engine.proto.MultiStageMover.overla.content: Motion overlays apply a pattern of movement (like a wave or spiral) on top of a mover's base motion.

dcei.engine.proto.MultiStageMover.Motion.content: When the scale of the overlay needs to change to a new value (e.g., from the initial launch scale of 0 to the target scale in the first stage, or between stages with different scale values), how fast it adjusts. The speed is relative to the mover's moving speed. A speed of 1 means the scale changes by 1 when the mover travels by 1 terrain grid-unit distance.

Overlays apply offsets to the mover position on the x-z plane (i.e., parallel to the terrain plane) by default. Set this rotation value to rotate the offset plane around the moving direction. E.g., sine-wave overlay moves the missile left then right; a rotation value of 180 will flip the offset plane and make the missile go right first.

dcei.engine.proto.Mover.orbiting.content: Moves the missile in an orbit around the target.

dcei.engine.proto.OrbitingMover.orbit_sp.content: Determines whether the orbit speed is controlled by a flat speed or degrees per second.

dcei.engine.proto.OrbitingMover.bind_to_.content: When checked, the mover will be destroyed if the caster dies.

dcei.engine.proto.OrbitingMover.life_per.content: When set, the missile unit will die after this duration.

dcei.engine.proto.OrbitingMover.rotation.content: Sets the axis of rotation for the orbit. The default axis is 0, 1, 0 for a clockwise rotation. An axis of 0, -1, 0 will create a counter-clockwise rotation.

dcei.engine.proto.OrbitingMover.radius_e.content: If set, the evaluated expression will be added to the radius when the missile unit is launched.

dcei.engine.proto.Mover.sine_wave.content: Moves the missile in a wave pattern towards the target with tracking.

dcei.engine.proto.SineWaveMover.amplitud.content: The width of the wave. Positive values mean the wave will start from the left while negative values mean the wave will start from the right. If set to 0, there will be no wave motion.

dcei.engine.proto.SineWaveMover.peak_cou.content: The number of peaks the wave will make between its origin and target. If set to 0, one peak will be used.

dcei.engine.proto.SineWaveMover.speed.content: The missile unit's speed, in terrain grid-units-per-second.

dcei.engine.proto.SineWaveMover.speed_ex.content: If set, the evaluated expression will be added to the speed when the missile unit is launched.

dcei.engine.proto.Mover.throw.content: Moves the missile unit in a fixed direction. Unlike other movers, this mover doesn't move towards the target and will move indefinitely unless some other means of hit detection are used (such as the arrive_on_search_hit flag), or replaced by another mover (either by another launch missile effect, or when used in a multi-stage mover).

dcei.engine.proto.Mover.content: Movers are a specialized data type that describe the movement pattern of units or missiles launched with the [Launch Missile](Data-Effect-Launch-Missile) effect.

dcei.engine.proto.Mover.upright.content:
When enabled, forces the missile unit to maintain its original up vector (rather than following the arc of movement).

Typically used for ballistic knockback movers to make the knockback motion look more natural.

dcei.engine.proto.Mover.no_rotation.content:
When enabled, forces the missile unit to maintain its original facing (rather than rotating towards the target position).

Typically used for ballistic knockback movers to make the knockback motion look more natural.

dcei.engine.proto.Mover.stay_on_nav_mesh.content: When enabled, attempts to keep the missile unit's target position inside the nav mesh. Useful for making knockback effects that respect nav mesh.

dcei.engine.proto.ProjectInfo.version.content: Version of the project (e.g., 1.2.3). Used when publishing the project.

dcei.engine.proto.ProjectInfo.entry_map.content: For game projects, this is the starting map when launching the game in arcade or in standalone build. For library projects, this is the map that will be imported by dependents.

dcei.engine.proto.PlayerSettings.player_.content:
Used to set the maximum number of players for multiplayer games.

Currently only 1v1 games are supported on the [arcade](https://platform.wildsky.dev/).

dcei.engine.proto.DisplaySettings.orient.content:
Sets the display mode to be landscape (default) or portrait.

**LANDSCAPE**:  the game will display in landscape mode

**PORTRAIT**:  the game will display in portrait mode

dcei.engine.proto.DisplaySettings.resiza.content: If set, the application window can be resized.

dcei.engine.proto.InputSettings.key_mapp.content: Defines key mappings that trigger **[DCEI.TriggerAddMappedKeyDownEvent()](Trigger-API-Reference-DCEI-Events-Input#void-triggeraddmappedkeydowneventstring-keyeventname-typedcallbackstring-trigger)** events for PC and web games.

dcei.engine.proto.InputSettings.KeyMappi.content: The name to use for the mapped key event (ex: "shoot").
The key mapped to this name.

dcei.engine.proto.FontSettings.override_.content: Allows you to override the default text font per-language.

dcei.engine.proto.FontSettings.FontSetti.content: The font to use for this language.

dcei.engine.proto.BuildSettings.image_co.content: The quality level (0 to 10) when compressing custom image assets. A lower value can help reduce the asset size but will also lower the image quality. Default is 10 (the highest).

dcei.engine.proto.BuildSettings.disable_.content: Disable language selection options in the game. Use this when your game isn't localized yet.

dcei.engine.proto.GameSettings.simulatio.content:
Use 32fps might reduce game latencies, but it would also greatly increase amount of work engine needs to do, resulting in game fps drop. Not recommended for mobile games.

**FPS_16**:  

**FPS_32**:

dcei.engine.proto.GameSettings.initializ.content: The number of frames at the beginning of the game that are used to initialize data/UI etc. and take a long time to finish. The engine will wait for these frames to finish before progressing the loading bar to 100% and transition into the game view.

dcei.engine.proto.GraphicsSettings.use_s.content: If true, all units will use "blob" shadows instead of detailed shadows.

dcei.engine.proto.GraphicsSettings.use_l.content: Set this to true if you want GpuAnimations to cast shadows on sprites. This will also disable GpuAnimations casting shadows on non-flat surfaces.
Use the legacy lighting system (recommended for mobile games). This will force use_legacy_shadows to be true.

dcei.engine.proto.GraphicsSettings.outli.content:
**WITHOUT_INNER_LINES**:  No inner lines on the inside of the unit and if two units overlap, the outline will only be visible around them.

**WITH_INNER_LINES**:  Inner lines will be rendered on the inside of the unit between different body parts and between overlapping units.

dcei.engine.proto.GraphicsSettings.use_l.content: By default, an outline width of 1 means 1/100 of the screen height. When the screen height increases, the size of both units and their outline increases proportionally so the outline to unit size ratio stays the same. Set this to true if you want to use the legacy mode where an outline width of 1 means 1/100 of the screen width. In the legacy mode, the outline to unit size ratio changes with the screen aspect ratio and the outline will look different from device to device.

dcei.engine.proto.CanvasSettings.referen.content: If the device's resolution does not match the reference width or height, the UI will be scaled up until either the width or the height matches device's resolution. In order to prevent custom sprites from being scaled, either the reference width or height should match the final device's resolution. These are 1344x750 by default.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.content: Units are the core interactive game object of the editor. All other data types (such as abilities, weapons, and behaviors) interact with units in some way, shape, or form.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitStatsComponent.rad.content: Determines the collision size of the unit.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitStatsComponent.inv.content: When checked, the unit will match the "Invulnerable" [target filters](Data-Effect-Area-Search#filter). Note that currently this flag does not actually make the unit immortal or invulnerable.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitStatsComponent.gro.content: When checked, the unit will collide with other ground units and match the "Ground" [target filters](Data-Effect-Area-Search#filter).

dcei.engine.proto.UnitStatsComponent.air.content: When checked, the unit will collide with other air units and match the "Air" [target filters](Data-Effect-Area-Search#filter).

dcei.engine.proto.UnitStatsComponent.sel.content: Determines whether or not the unit can be selected.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitStatsComponent.tar.content: Determines the target priority for the "Target Priority" [target filter sort key](GenericEnum#searchfilterfiltersortmethod). Default target priority is 10. Useful for making certain units higher or lower priority attack targets.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitStatsComponent.sel.content: Determines the unit selection priority when multiple units are overlapping. Higher priority units will be selected over lower priority units.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitStatsComponent.ign.content: When checked, the unit will ignore collision with other units. Note that this does not affect navigation mesh pathfinding (ie collision with props).
When checked, the unit will ignore navigation mesh and move in a direct line to its target position.

dcei.engine.proto.HealthComponent.max_he.content: The maximum health of the unit.

dcei.engine.proto.HealthComponent.start_.content: The starting health of the unit. By default this will use the **Max Health** value.

dcei.engine.proto.HealthComponent.regene.content: The amount of health the unit regenerates per second.
The delay after the unit takes damage before it begins regenerating health. Useful for making health only regenerate outside of combat.

dcei.engine.proto.ManaComponent.max_mana.content: The maximum mana of the unit.

dcei.engine.proto.ManaComponent.start_ma.content: The starting mana of the unit. By default this will use the **Max Mana** value.

dcei.engine.proto.ManaComponent.regenera.content: The amount of mana the unit regenerates per second.
The delay after the spends mana before it begins regenerating mana.

dcei.engine.proto.ShieldComponent.max_sh.content: The maximum shields of the unit.

dcei.engine.proto.ShieldComponent.start_.content: The starting shields of the unit. By default this will use the **Max Shield** value.

dcei.engine.proto.ShieldComponent.regene.content: The amount of shields the unit regenerates per second.
The delay after the unit takes damage before it begins regenerating shields.

dcei.engine.proto.MovementComponent.move.content: The movement speed of the unit, in terrain grid-units-per-second.

dcei.engine.proto.MovementComponent.unit.content: The visual height of the unit. Useful for making flying units appear to be flying in the air.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitTurningComponent.t.content: The turning speed of the unit. Note that the unit must turn before moving if the target position is greater than 90 degrees from the unit's facing.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorComponent.oneo.content: Controls the AI behavior type of the unit. Most of the time this should be set to **Generic Controllable Unit**. It's generally recommended to not use **Td Types** unless you know what you're doing and are creating a similar tower defense game.

dcei.engine.proto.RallyPointComponent.of.content: The offset applied to [Set Rally Point](Data-Effect-Set-Rally-Point) effects.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitValueComponent.gol.content:
The base gold cost of the unit.

Can be used to set the cost of morph abilities using [Use Unit Cost Difference](Data-Ability#use-unit-cost-difference). Can be modified by ability cost when using [Add To Unit Cost](Data-Ability#add-to-unit-cost).

dcei.engine.proto.UnitReferences.weapon_.content: Which [Weapons](Data-Weapon) are available to the unit. Weapons are prioritized from top to bottom.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitReferences.ability.content: Which [Abilities](Data-Ability) are available to the unit. Abilities are prioritized from top to bottom.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitReferences.behavio.content: Which [Behaviors](Data-Behavior) the unit starts with. Behaviors are applied from top to bottom.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitReferences.on_star.content: If set, this [Ability](Data-Ability) will be cast when the unit is created. This ability will be added to the unit's **Ability List** if not already present.

dcei.engine.proto.Tag.name.content: The name of the tag to apply.

dcei.engine.proto.Tag.count.content: The number of stacks of the tag to apply.

dcei.engine.proto.Tag.duration.content: The duration the tag will last (the default setting will last indefinitely).

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.level.content: A unit level reference that can be referenced in validator expressions. Current usage is limited.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.display_name.content: Sets the display name of the unit, which can be referenced in triggers with [DCEI.GetUnitDisplayName()](Trigger-API-Reference-DCEI-Functions-Unit#string-getunitdisplaynameunit-unit). Accepts string or localization key.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.ingame_icon.content: Sets the unit icon as displayed by [DCEI.ShowUnitStatusUiInSlot()](InGame-UI-Functions-Overview#hero-status). Enabling the **custom** flag allows you to specify any texture (using the asset name, not asset path).

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.bind_ability_ui.content: When enabled, the unit will display its ability menu when selected, similar to [DCEI.ShowAbilitiesUi()](InGame-UI-Functions-Overview#circle-menu). Useful for quickly testing abilities.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.health_bar.content: The type of health bar to display.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.HealthBarOption.t.content:
**DEFAULT**:  The default health bar. Displays in green for allied units and red for enemy units.

**GENERAL**:  The default health bar. Displays in green for allied units and red for enemy units.

**SHIP**:  A massive health bar. Displays in green for allied and enemy units.

**HERO**:  A bigger health bar. Displays in green for allied and enemy units.

**DOT_MANA**:  Displays mana as a large yellow bar with 10 segments.

**DOT_HEALTH**:  Displays health as a large yellow bar with 10 segments.

**HEALTH_WITH_MANA**:  Same as **SHIP** but additional displays mana in purple.

**NONE**:  Shows no health bar for the unit.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.HealthBarOption.s.content: Some health bars will automatically hide when the unit's health is full. Set this flag will override this behavior and make it always show.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitEventTriggers.on_u.content: Effects will be triggered when the unit is created.
Effects will be triggered when the unit dies.
Effects will be triggered when the unit is removed.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.dependent_units.content: Dependent units will be loaded when the unit is loaded

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.dependent_effects.content: Dependent effects will be loaded when the unit is loaded

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.dependent_behavio.content: Dependent behaviors will be loaded when the unit is loaded

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.dependent_sprite_.content: Dependent sprites will be loaded when this unit is loaded.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.mini_map_config.content: These settings determine how the unit will be rendered on a minimap frame.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.MiniMapConfig.min.content: Determines whether the unit renders as a circle or sprite on the minimap.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.MiniMapConfig.sho.content: When enabled, causes the unit to render on minimap frames.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.MiniMapConfig.ren.content: Higher render priority units will display above lower priority ones in the minimap.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.MiniMapConfig.tin.content: Sets the tint color of the unit's minimap render using RGB values.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.affinity_index.content: The affinity of this unit. Only set this field if: 1. this is a hero unit. 2. and this hero is used as a built-in hero (i.e., not added through a loadout hero card but available in the level automatically). The mapping: 1 => normal 2 => fire 3 => ice 4 => nature 5 => light 6 => dark

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.card_name.content: Name of the card this unit is associated with. Used for reporting in-game stats. It's automatically set by the engine when loading card information. Only set it explicitly if the unit belongs to a card that hasn't been implemented yet and you want to gather stats for it.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.content:
Validators are conditions that evaluate to true or false. Validators can be plugged into other data types and can be used to [remove](Data-Behavior#behavior-validators-remove)/[disable behaviors](Data-Behavior#behavior-validators-disable), add additional checks to determine if a [weapon](Data-Weapon#validators) or [ability](Data-Ability#validators) can fire, or create if/then/elseif style statements within [effects](Data-Effect-Switch-Effect) (among other uses). 
See our notion guide on [Using Validators](https://www.notion.so/funovus/Using-Validators-dcf07ecd524d48548302cd77b9633e29)

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.unit_within_.content: Returns true if the specified number of units are found within a search radius.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.UnitWithinRa.content: The radius of the circle to search.
Returns true if the number of units found is between this min and max.
Determines whether to consider unit radius or center point when finding targets.
Determines whether to extend the search radius by the source unit's radius.

Similar to other search filters.
See: [Data/Effect/Area Search](Data-Effect-Area-Search#filter)
Target units must pass these validators to be considered valid targets.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.nearby_unit_.content:
Returns true if a number of units are found within a search radius with a specific health value.

Shares many fields with [Unit Within Range](#unit-within-range).

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.NearbyUnitHe.content: The radius of the circle to search.
Returns true if the number of units found is between this min and max.
Whether the validator will check units' health as an **Absolute** or **Percentage** (between 0 and 1).
Returns true if enough units are found with health within this min and max.

Determines how many units must be found with the health value specified in **Health Value Range**.

Note that the total number of units found must also satisfy the **Unit Count Range**.
Determines whether to consider unit radius or center point when finding targets.
Determines whether to extend the search radius by the source unit's radius.

Similar to other search filters.
See: [Data/Effect/Area Search](Data-Effect-Area-Search#filter)

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.health_value.content: Returns true if a unit has health within a specific range.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.HealthValue..content: Which unit will be considered by the validator. Using NONE defaults to TARGET_UNIT.
Returns true if the checked unit's health is within this min and max.
Whether the validator will check health as an **Absolute** or **Percentage** (between 0 and 1).

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.troop_amount.content: Returns true of the unit has a specified number of child troop units.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.TroopAmount..content: Returns true of the unit has a specified number of child troop units.
Returns true if enough units are found with health within this min and max.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.is_child.content: Returns true if the child_unit is a child troop of parent_unit.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.unit_filter.content: Returns true if a unit matches a specific [unit type](Data-Unit#unit-type) (unit, missile, or structure).

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.UnitFilter.v.content: Returns true if the specified unit is of this type.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.UnitFilter.w.content: Which unit will be considered by the validator.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.combine.content:
Allows you to combine other validators using logical operators.

Combine validators can be nested. Can be combined with [negate](#negate) for even more logic.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.Combine.oper.content:
**AND**:  Returns true if all of the listed validators are true.

**OR**:  Returns true if any of the listed validators are true.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.Combine.vali.content: The list of validators to combine.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.unit_engaged.content: Returns true if the specified unit is engaged.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.unit_type.content: Returns true if a unit is of a specific type.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.UnitType.uni.content: Returns true if the unit is of this type.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.UnitType.whi.content: Which unit will be considered by the validator.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.location_is_.content: Returns true if a point is in a lane (as defined in Terrain/WayPoints/Routes).

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.LocationIsLa.content: If enabled, routes using the "Disable Rally" flag won't be considered.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.unit_ai_beha.content: Returns true if a unit has the specified [AI Behavior type](Data-Unit#behavior).

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.UnitAiBehavi.content: Returns true if the unit has this AI behavior type.
Which unit will be considered by the validator.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.wave_started.content: Returns true if the first wave has started.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.unit_stats.content:
Returns true if a unit matches the specified unit filter.

Currently only supports checking if the unit is an [air](Data-Unit#unit-stats) unit.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.UnitStats.wh.content: Which unit will be considered by the validator.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.UnitStats.ai.content: Returns true if the unit matches this filter.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.point_on_nav.content: Returns true if a point is on the nav mesh.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.effect_criti.content:
Returns true if the effect tree is a critical hit.

Note that this is only relevant for effect trees created by [abilities](Data-Ability#critical-chance) or [weapons](Data-Weapon#critical-chance).

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.unit_is_movi.content: Returns true if a unit is currently moving.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.UnitIsMoving.content: Which unit to check. Using NONE defaults to TARGET_UNIT.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.point_on_cli.content: Returns true if a point is on the cliff.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.expression.content: Returns the result of the evaluated [expression](Data-Expression). Non-zero numbers are treated as true, 0 is treated as false.

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.negate.content: Flips the result of the validator, similar to the `not` in Lua (true becomes false, false becomes true).

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.content:
Weapons are used to create auto-attacks for units. Similar to abilities, weapons create effect trees that determine their functionality. 
**Common Weapon Patterns**
* **Melee Weapon**: Weapon > [Damage](Data-Effect-Damage)
* **Melee Weapon (AOE)**: Weapon > [Area Search](Data-Effect-Area-Search) > [Damage](Data-Effect-Damage)
* **Ranged Weapon**: Weapon > [Launch Missile](Data-Effect-Launch-Missile) > [Damage](Data-Effect-Damage)

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.family.content: Used for enabling/disabling families of weapons via behaviors.

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.effect.content:
The Effect created by the weapon on the target unit.

See: [Data/Effect](Data-Effect)

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.critical_chance.content: The chance that the weapon attack is considered a critical. The value is a fraction, so 0 is 0% chance and 1 is 100% chance of critical hit.

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.critical_effect.content:
The effect that is executed instead of the Effect when the ability is a critical. If this is not set, the default Effect will be used on critical instead.

See: [Data/Effect](Data-Effect)

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.independent_tar.content:
If this is set, this weapon can acquire its own target and search for a target.

When checked, the weapon can acquire its own target, rather than being limited to the current target of the unit. This is useful for making secondary weapons.

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.independent_pre.content:
If this is checked, this weapon can fire when other weapons are in pre or back swing stage.

When checked, the weapon can be fired while other weapons on the unit are in preswing/backswing state. Otherwise only weapon can be fired at a time.

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.can_fire_while_.content:
If this is checked, using this weapon will not stop movement.

When checked, allows the weapon to be used while the unit is moving.

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.channeled.content:
If this is checked, this weapon will be a channelling weapon along with a channeling persistent effect

When checked, the weapon will function as a channeled weapon if the [effect](#effect) is a [persistent](Data-Effect-Persistent) effect.
Channeled weapons will continuously fire after the [Pre Swing](#pre-swing), using data from the persistent effect:
* The [periodic durations](Data-Effect-Persistent#periodic-durations) as the channeled tick rate. 
* The [periodic effects](Data-Effect-Persistent#periodic-effects) as the channeled effects each tick rate.
* The [periodic count](Data-Effect-Persistent#periodic-count) for will be ignored, as the weapon will fire continuously as long as it has a valid target.

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.force_cast_foll.content:
If target dies, this flag will keep the weapon firing to the last valid target position

When checked, the weapon will continue firing and execute its effect if the target dies or becomes invalid during the [Pre Swing](#pre-swing), rather than canceling the attack (and attack animation).
This tends to make ranged weapon attack animations look better when facing many targets as it prevents the unit from continuously canceling animations.

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.no_turn_outside.content:
If the flag is set and target is out of arc, this weapon cannot be used to attack

When checked, the unit won't turn to face targets that are outside of the primary weapon [arc](#arc). This is useful for units that are not meant to turn (such as in shoot-em-up type games).

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.validators.content:
Weapon does not execute if any validator fails (does not trigger cost or cooldown)

Each [validator](Data-Validator) must succeed in order for the weapon to be able to be fire.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponStats.pre_swing.content:
The delay between the weapon starting to fire and the effect being executed.

Used with [Back Swing](#back-swing) for the purposes of animating the unit.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponStats.random_pre.content:
The minimum random delay added to the weapon's Pre Swing stats. Supports negative numbers.

Useful for preventing groups of units that share the same weapon from firing in sync.
The maximum random delay added to the weapon's Pre Swing stats. Supports negative numbers.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponStats.back_swing.content:
The delay between the effect being executed and the weapon firing state ending.

Used with [Pre Swing](#pre-swing) for the purposes of animating the unit. The sum of [Pre Swing](#pre-swing) plus [Back Swing](#back-swing) is the minimum cooldown of the weapon.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponStats.period.content:
The cooldown of the weapon or how long the unit must wait to use it again.

The duration of the cooldown is effectively extended by the [Pre Swing](#pre-swing), as the period doesn't begin counting down until after the damage point.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponStats.use_initia.content: If checked, this weapon will start on cooldown.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponStats.use_cooldo.content: If checked, this weapon will enter cooldown when it is disabled then enabled.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponStats.minimal_ra.content: The minimum distance the weapon can fire at.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponStats.range.content: The maximum distance the weapon can fire at.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponStats.scan_range.content:
The range that the unit will use to search for targets to acquire when using this weapon.

Typically set to the same value as [Range](#range).

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponStats.arc.content:
The angle in front of the caster that targets must be in. If the target is outside this arc, the caster will attempt to turn to face the target before casting.

Example: Arc 360 means the ability can be cast in any direction, 90 is a cone in front, and 0 is directly facing the target.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponStats.buffer_ran.content:
Determines the distance targets must move beyond of the weapon range that will cause the weapon to cancel during pre swing. The default value of 0 causes the buffer range to be infinite.

Determines the distance targets must move beyond of the weapon range that will cause the weapon to cancel during pre swing. The default value of 0 causes the buffer range to be infinite.

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.target_filter.content: Used to determine the valid target types for the weapon.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.pri.content: Potential targets are sorted based on these parameters.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.Pri.content: The method used to sort potential targets.
The order in which potential targets are sorted for priority.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.sec.content: If a pair of targets have the same priority value due to Primary Sort Keys, this sort key is then used to determine which unit to target.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.Sec.content: The method used to sort potential targets.
The order in which potential targets are sorted for priority.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.pla.content: Targets owned by the player that created the search will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.all.content: Targets owned by an ally of the player that created the search will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.ene.content: Targets owned by an enemy of the player that created the search will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.neu.content: Targets that are neutral to the player that created the search will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.uni.content: Targets that use the "Unit" category will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.mis.content: Targets that use the "Missile" category will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.str.content: Targets that use the "Structure" category will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.air.content: Targets that use air unit collision will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.gro.content: Targets that use ground unit collision will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.ste.content: Targets with a behavior that uses the stealth flag will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.inv.content: Targets with the invulnerable flag will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.WeaponSearchFilter.ali.content: Targets that are currently alive will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.Weapon.disabled.content: When checked, the weapon is disabled by default. Requires behaviors or other means to be enabled.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitActor.SelectionSha.content:
**SPHERE**:  The actor will use a sphere shape for hit tests (default)

**CUBE**:  The actor will use a cube shape for hit tests

dcei.engine.proto.SpriteOptions.Renderin.content:
**BACKGROUND**:  Background sprites are rendered below shadow and other sprites. To make the sprite render below units, put the sprite further away from the camera.

**FOREGROUND**:  Foreground sprites are rendered above shadow and background sprites. To make the sprite render above units, put the sprite closer to the camera.

**OVERLAY**:  Overlay sprites are rendered above all other objects except for UI.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Orientat.content:
**WORLD_ORIENTATION**:  Sets the site operation relative to world facing (north is up).

**ACTOR_ORIENTATION**:  Sets the site operation relative to the actor's facing.

**ACTOR_ORIENTATION_IGNORING_OTHER_SITE_OPERATIONS**:  Sets the site operation relative to the actor's facing before any other site operations are applied.

**EVENT_ORIENTATION**:  Makes the actor face the source of the triggering event (supports **Unit Weapon Start** and **Unit Ability Start**).

**MOVE_ORIENTATION**:  Makes the actor's orientation align with its 3D movement vector.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorComponent.Beha.content:
**DO_NOTHING**:  The unit has no AI behavior.

**GENERIC_CONTROLLABLE_UNIT**:  The unit has basic RTS behavior.

**TD_HERO**:  The unit is a WildSky TD hero.

**TD_HERO_PET**:  The unit is a WildSky TD hero pet.

**TD_TOWER**:  The unit is a WildSky TD tower.

**TD_TOWER_TROOP**:  The unit is a WildSky TD tower troop.

**TD_CREEP**:  The unit is a WildSky TD creep.

**TD_CREEP_AGGRESSIVE**:  The unit is a WildSky TD creep that actively searches for targets.

**TD_CreepNoEngage**:  The unit is a WildSky TD non-aggressive creep.

**TD_JUNGLE_CREEP**:  The unit is a WildSky TD jungle creep.

**TD_SHIP**:  The unit is a WildSky TD ship.

**TD_SUMMONED_TROOP**:  The unit is a WildSky TD summoned troop.

**WANDER**:  The unit wanders aimlessly.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.FilterSor.content:
**NONE**:  Targets are sorted randomly.

**TARGET_PRIORITY**:  Targets are sorted by target priority.

**REMAINING_PATH_DISTANCE**:  Targets are sorted by waypoints distance.

**DISTANCE_TO_SEARCH_CENTER**:  Targets are sorted by proximity to search center.

**HEALTH_VALUE**:  Targets are sorted by current health.

**HEALTH_MAX**:  Targets are sorted by total health.

**HEALTH_FRACTION**:  Targets are sorted by health percentage.

**VITALS**:  Targets are sorted by current health + shield.

**VITALS_MAX**:  Targets are sorted by total health + shield.

**VITALS_FRACTION**:  Targets are sorted by health + shield percentage.

**SHIELD_VALUE**:  Targets are sorted by current shield value.

**SHIELD_MAX**:  Targets are sorted by total shield value.

**SHIELD_FRACTION**:  Targets are sorted by shield percentage.

**ENGAGED**:  Targets are sorted by engaged state.

**UNIT_COST**:  Targets are sorted by cost.

**DISTANCE_TO_EFFECT_SOURCE**:  Targets are sorted by distance to the effect source.

**LOWEST_FIRST**:  Values are sorted from lowest to highest.

**HIGHEST_FIRST**:  Values are sorted from highest to lowest.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.Flag.content:
**ALLOWED**:  If the target has this type, it is still valid.

**REQUIRED**:  The target must have this type in order to be valid.

**EXCLUDED**:  If the target has this type it is invalid, even if it has a required type.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectUnitTarget.Type.content:
**NONE**:  

**TARGET_UNIT**:  the target unit of the previous effect, weapon, ability, or behavior.

**SOURCE_UNIT**:  the last unit involved in the effect tree (a previous target, spawned unit, or missile).

**CASTER_UNIT**:  the first unit involved in the effect tree (typically the unit that used the weapon or ability).

dcei.engine.proto.DistanceCheckModes.content:
**CHECK_CLOSEST_EDGE**:  Targets are considered to be in-range if the outer edge of their radius is in-range.

**CHECK_CENTER_ONLY**:  Targets are considered to be in-range if their center position is in-range.

dcei.engine.proto.DistanceExtendModes.content:
**NO_EXTEND**:  The caster's radius is not added to the ability's range.

**INCLUDE_SOURCE_UNIT_RADIUS**:  The caster's radius is added to the ability's range.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAreaSearch.Inclu.content:
**NORMAL**:  Use default settings for this unit.

**INCLUDE**:  This unit will always be included in the search.

**EXCLUDE**:  This unit will always be excluded in the search.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectPersistent.Selec.content:
Determines how the periodic duration, effect, or offset is selected.

**SEQUENCE**:  Values are selected in order from top to bottom.

**RANDOM**:  Values are selected randomly with no additional rules.

**RANDOM_NO_REPEAT**:  Values are selected randomly with no sequentially repeating values (if possible).

**RANDOM_SHUFFLE**:  Values will be put in a random order and then selected in that order.

dcei.engine.proto.ValueType.content:
**PERCENTAGE**:  Use percentage values.

**VALUE**:  Use a literal value.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectModifyUnit.Modif.content:
**NONE_MODIFY_TYPE**:  

**ADD**:  Add the amount to current amount.

**SET**:  Set current amount.

dcei.engine.proto.SimpleSearchFilter.Fil.content:
**NONE**:  Targets are sorted randomly.

**DISTANCE_TO_SEARCH_CENTER**:  Targets are sorted by proximity to search center.

**DISTANCE_TO_EFFECT_SOURCE**:  Targets are sorted by distance to the effect source.

**LOWEST_FIRST**:  Values are sorted from lowest to highest.

**HIGHEST_FIRST**:  Values are sorted from highest to lowest.

dcei.engine.proto.SimpleSearchFilter.Fla.content:
**ALLOWED**:  If the target has this type, it is still valid.

**REQUIRED**:  The target must have this type in order to be valid.

**EXCLUDED**:  If the target has this type it is invalid, even if it has a required type.

dcei.engine.proto.ThrowMover.Orientation.content:
**TARGET_ORIENTATION**:  Orientation is relative to the direction from launch position to target position ignoring height differences.

**WORLD_ORIENTATION**:  Orientation is relative to world facing (i.e., north).

dcei.engine.proto.Validator.ValidatorVal.content:
**NONE**:  Defaults to using absolute value.

**ABSOLUTE**:  Use a literal value for comparison.

**PERCENTAGE**:  Use percentage values for comparison (between 0 and 1).

dcei.engine.proto.UnitComponent.UnitType.content:
**UNIT**:  The unit type is unit

**MISSILE**:  The unit type is missile

**STRUCTURE**:  The unit type is structure

dcei.engine.proto.ValidatorExpressions.U.content:
**CASTER_UNIT**:  The first unit involved in the effect tree (typically the unit that used the weapon or ability).

**SOURCE_UNIT**:  The last unit involved in the effect tree (a previous target, spawned unit, or missile).

**TARGET_UNIT**:  The target unit of the previous effect, weapon, ability, or behavior.

GenericField.template.content: When checked, this object is considered a template and will only be able to be referenced as a template or parent by other objects. Ex, template units cannot be placed in the terrain or created via CreateUnit.

GenericField.parent.content: Sets the parent for this object. An object will inherit all fields from their parent (displayed in grey).

dcei.engine.proto.ActorResource.priority.content: Currently only works for actors with ParticleAnimation resource type. Particle animations with a priority level lower than the game's VFX priority level won't be created. This can be set using DCEI.SetVfxPriorityLevel(). Note that the actor will be created, just not the particle animation

dcei.engine.proto.SpriteOptions.disable_.content: Set actor with sprite asset not billboard facing camera, default sprite will keep facing camera

dcei.engine.proto.SpriteOptions.center_s.content: Set actor with sprite asset anchor to center, default will be bottom of the sprite

dcei.engine.proto.SpriteOptions.flip_x.content: If checked, flips the sprite horizontally.

dcei.engine.proto.SpriteOptions.flip_y.content: If checked, flips the sprite vertically.

dcei.engine.proto.SpriteOptions.renderin.content: Sprites from different rendering groups are rendered in different phases of the engine's render pipeline. Set a proper rendering group to make the sprite render above/below other objects.

Sets the sprite's rendering priority. Sprites within the same rendering group will be sorted by the rendering priority before rendering. To make the sprite render above/below other objects, set a proper rendering group.

dcei.engine.proto.SpriteOptions.enable_x.content: If checked, this allow sprites using camera facing to retain any rotations applied on the X or Z planes. This typically used with missile sprite actors to preserve mover rotations.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Offset.content: Applies an offset to the actor's position.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Offset.x.content: Left/Right offset. Positive values are offset right, negative values are offset left.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Offset.y.content: Up/Down offset. Positive values are up, negative values are down.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Offset.z.content: Forward/Back offset. Positive values are forward, negative values are back.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Offset.x.content:
If set, a random value between 0 and the X Range will be applied to the X offset when this site operation is applied. Only accepts positive values.

Example: X is -1 and X Range is 2 will result in a random X offset between -1 and 1.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Offset.y.content: If set, a random value between 0 and the Y Range will be applied to the Y offset when this site operation is applied. Only accepts positive values.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Offset.z.content: If set, a random value between 0 and the Z Range will be applied to the Z offset when this site operation is applied. Only accepts positive values.

dcei.engine.proto.SiteOperation.Offset.o.content: Determines relative direction of the offset.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitBattleData.enemy_s.content: The unit will search for enemies to attack within this radius.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitBattleData.engage_.content: The unit will search for enemies to engage within this radius.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitBattleData.reset_r.content: The unit will leash if it leaves this radius.

dcei.engine.proto.UnitBattleData.chase_i.content: Used for generic controllable unit. If target is outside of the range, the unit will stop chasing and go back

dcei.engine.proto.UnitBattleData.force_r.content: Time in seconds for weapons to be forced to rescan targets.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.SearchFil.content: The method used to sort potential targets.
The order in which potential targets are sorted for priority.

dcei.engine.proto.MorphParameters.reset_.content: If unchecked, new unit will retain the same health percentage as before the morph.
If unchecked, new unit will retain the same mana percentage as before the morph.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.primary_s.content: Potential targets are sorted based on these parameters.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.secondary.content: If a pair of targets have the same priority value due to Primary Sort Keys, this sort key is then used to determine which unit to target.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.player.content: Targets owned by the player that created the search will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.ally.content: Targets owned by an ally of the player that created the search will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.enemy.content: Targets owned by an enemy of the player that created the search will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.neutral.content: Targets that are neutral to the player that created the search will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.unit.content: Targets that use the "Unit" category will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.missile.content: Targets that use the "Missile" category will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.structure.content: Targets that use the "Structure" category will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.air.content: Targets that use air unit collision will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.ground.content: Targets that use ground unit collision will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.stealth.content: Targets with a behavior that uses the stealth flag will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.invulerab.content: Targets with the invulnerable flag will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.SearchFilter.alive.content: Targets that are currently alive will match the filter.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectOffset.PolarOffs.content: Yaw (nose left or right, positive is right) around the normal axis in degrees .
Pitch (nose up or down, positive is down) around the transverse axis in degrees.

dcei.engine.proto.SimpleSearchFilter.Sea.content: The method used to sort potential targets.
The order in which potential targets are sorted for priority.

dcei.engine.proto.ValueWithRangeAndExpre.content: A random value between 0 and this value is added to the base value.
If set, the evaluated expression will be added to the base value.

dcei.engine.proto.GuidanceMover.accelera.content: This value is added to the missile unit's speed each second.
If set, the evaluated expression will be added to the acceleration when the missile unit is launched.
A random value between 0 and this value is added to the missile unit's acceleration.

dcei.engine.proto.GuidanceMover.speed.content: The missile unit's initial speed, in terrain grid-units-per-second.

dcei.engine.proto.GuidanceMover.speed_ex.content: If set, the evaluated expression will be added to the speed when the missile unit is launched.

dcei.engine.proto.GuidanceMover.speed_ra.content: A random value between 0 and this value is added to the missile unit's speed.

dcei.engine.proto.GuidanceMover.min_spee.content: The minimum speed the missile unit can move.

dcei.engine.proto.GuidanceMover.max_spee.content: The maximum speed the missile unit can move. Note that this needs to be above 0 for the missile unit to go anywhere.

dcei.engine.proto.BallisticMover.flight_.content: When set, the missile unit's speed will be adjusted so that it takes this time to reach its target, regardless of the distance. When using flight time, speed should be set to 0.
If set, the evaluated expression will be added to the flight time when the missile unit is launched.
A random value between 0 and this value is added to the missile unit's flight time.

dcei.engine.proto.BallisticMover.speed.content: Speed of the mover. When using speed, flight time should be set to 0. Speed is measured in terrain grid-units-per-second.

dcei.engine.proto.BallisticMover.speed_e.content: If set, the evaluated expression will be added to the speed when the missile unit is launched.

dcei.engine.proto.BallisticMover.speed_r.content: A random value between 0 and this value is added to the missile unit's speed.

dcei.engine.proto.BallisticMover.gravity.content: Used to determine the height of the arc. Higher values mean a higher arc.

dcei.engine.proto.ThrowMover.acceleratio.content: This value is added to the missile unit's speed each second.

dcei.engine.proto.ThrowMover.speed.content: The missile unit's initial speed, in terrain grid-units-per-second.

dcei.engine.proto.ThrowMover.min_speed.content: The minimum speed the missile unit can move.

dcei.engine.proto.ThrowMover.max_speed.content: The maximum speed the missile unit can move. Note that this needs to be above 0 for the missile unit to go anywhere.

dcei.engine.proto.ThrowMover.Orientation.content: Turn right or left in degrees (positive is right, negative is left).
Turn down or up in degrees (positive is down, negative is up).

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorComponent.do_n.content: The unit will have no AI behavior. This causes the unit to be unable to move, attack, or otherwise accept commands.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorComponent.gene.content: The unit will use the basic AI behavior and accept commands. Generic controllable units with weapons will attempt to attack valid targets in range.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorComponent.Beha.content: Units will only chase auto-acquired targets within this radius. If the unit leaves this radius, it will be ordered to return to its original position (ie the origin of the leash radius). The unit will not be able to auto-acquire a new target until it reaches the leash reset radius. The position of the leash region only updates when a unit becomes idle.

Leashed units (ones that have abandoned their auto-acquired targets and are moving towards their original position) are allowed to acquire new targets within this radius. The leash reset region uses the same origin as the leash region (and updates with it). The purpose of using two regions is to prevent attackers from being able to kite defenders by jumping in and out of the leash radius; The leash reset radius should be significantly smaller than the leash radius to provide the defender a decent area to retreat to.
If set, the unit will be forced to reconsider its current weapon target each period. Otherwise weapons tend to stick to the current target until it becomes invalid or dies.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorComponent.wand.content: The unit will wander aimlessly. Useful for villagers or critters.

dcei.engine.proto.BehaviorComponent.Beha.content: The unit will wait for this duration before wandering to a new location.
The unit will wander within this radius.

dcei.engine.proto.Unit.MiniMapConfig.Min.content: The radius to use for the unit's minimap icon.
The sprite name to use for the unit's minimap icon.
The size to use for the unit's minimap icon.

dcei.engine.proto.AreaSearchCircle.radiu.content: Sets the radius of the circle to search.
Any expressions here will be evaluated and added to the **radius** each time the search is executed.

dcei.engine.proto.AreaSearchCircleSector.content: Sets the outer radius of the circle sector to search.
Any expressions here will be evaluated and added to the **outer radius** each time the search is executed.
Sets the inner radius of the circle sector to search.
Any expressions here will be evaluated and added to the **inner radius** each time the search is executed.
Sets the angle of the circle sector to search. Used to make a search occur in an arc.
Any expressions here will be evaluated and added to the **angle** each time the search is executed.

dcei.engine.proto.AreaSearchRectangle.re.content:
Sets the origin point of the rectangle.

**CENTER**:  The rectangle search will be centered on the target position.

**EXTEND**:  The search will be offset so its starting edge will originate at the target position. Using this setting, the search will extend from its target position rather than be centered on it.

dcei.engine.proto.AreaSearchRectangle.wi.content: Sets the width of the rectangle to search.
Any expressions here will be evaluated and added to the **width** each time the search is executed.

dcei.engine.proto.AreaSearchRectangle.le.content: Sets the length of the rectangle to search.
Any expressions here will be evaluated and added to the **length** each time the search is executed.

dcei.engine.proto.AreaSearchType.childre.content: The search will find the source unit's children.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectSetWaypoints.Way.content: Which routes will be searched, when set to NONE, all routes will be searched.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectEnumerateUnitLis.content: Run the search using the **Search Effect** location.

Run successive searches at the previous target's location.

This is useful for creating chain lightning effects.
Creates a delay between each search.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectModifyUnit.Modif.content: Determines if the ability is selected by name, tag, or family.
The name of the ability to modify cooldown for.

The ability family to modify cooldowns for.

Note that all abilities with this family on the target will have their cooldown reduced.

The ability tags to modify cooldowns for.

Note that all abilities with this tag on the target will have their cooldown reduced.

The ability family to modify charge count for.
The ability tags to modify charge count for.
Determine the modify type
Whether to modify mana as percentage or explicit value.
The amount of mana to modify.
Determine the modify type
Whether to modify shields as percentage or explicit value.
The amount of shields to modify.
Determine the modify type
Whether to modify cooldown by a percentage or explicit value (in seconds).
The duration to modify cooldown by.
Determine the modify type
The amount to modify charge count by.
When checked, clamp charge count between 0 and max charge count.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectIssueAbility.abi.content: Select the ability to be cast by name.
Select the first ability with the matching tag on the unit to cast.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.direction.content: A force pointing towards the same direction.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.Direction..content: Offset in degrees added (clockwise) to the effect facing to determine the force's direction.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.center.content: A force pointing towards the effect center.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectForce.Center.dir.content: Offset in degrees added (clockwise) to the force's direction.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectAttachUnit.Attac.content: Offset is based on forward/right/up directions.
Offset is based on angle and distance.
Offset is based on the angle and distance between parent and child unit.

dcei.engine.proto.OffsetOrientation.offs.content: Used in combination with Offset End to determine the facing of this effect. If start & end is at the same point, facing of the source unit is used as a fallback and if source is not an unit, facing of the caster unit is used.

Used in combination with Offset Start to determine the facing of this effect. If start & end is at the same point, facing of the source unit is used as a fallback and if source is not an unit, facing of the caster unit is used.

dcei.engine.proto.EffectApplySimpleMover.content: The mover will move towards a target unit
When the mover become active after the effect applied
When the mover become inactive after the effect applied
The mover will move in one direction, determined by the angle between the source and target at launch
When the mover become active after the effect applied
When the mover become inactive after the effect applied

dcei.engine.proto.OrbitingMover.speed.content: When set, the missile unit's orbit speed, in terrain grid-units-per-second.

dcei.engine.proto.OrbitingMover.degree_p.content: When set, the missile unit's orbit speed, in degrees-per-second.

dcei.engine.proto.MultiStageMover.MoverS.content: Moves the missile unit linearly towards the target with tracking (like a guided missile).
Moves the missile unit in a parabolic arc (like a thrown grenade).

Moves the missile unit in a fixed direction. Unlike other movers, this mover doesn't move towards the target and will move indefinitely unless some other means of hit detection are used (such as the arrive_on_search_hit flag), or replaced by another mover (either by another launch missile effect, or when used in a multi-stage mover).

dcei.engine.proto.MultiStageMover.Motion.content: Moves in a sine wave pattern.

dcei.engine.proto.MultiStageMover.SineWa.content: The distance between consecutive wave patterns.

dcei.engine.proto.MultiStageMover.Motion.content: Moves with a circular motion centered around the mover's position without this overlay applied.

dcei.engine.proto.MultiStageMover.Orbiti.content: Circular speed in degrees per second.
